While there are strong versions of the kava plant (one is called "tudei" because its effects last for two days) this is gentle stuff indeed. Given that the strongly addictive xanax, which seems to greatly increase risk of dementia (see the People's Pharmacy recent article on this) is its chief competitor in the prescription arena, trying to scare people off kava is likely to be largely the work of drug company PR people. title: Stress Reducing, But What are the Side Effects?

It seemed like a good choice, but there was also the small issue of purported liver failures caused by its use back in 2002. So I was a little wary of making the purchase, but I went for it anyway, just to see what it was like. Took two this afternoon, and in about 20 minutes there was a noticeable calming effect and mild euphoria. Things were just... ok. Most impressive is the fact that I was able to write a fairly complicated computer program without once getting stressed out and without making any silly mistakes in the code (I always make mistakes, so this was fairly remarkable). Kava definitely does not inhibit mental processes like alcohol. The effects faded out, perhaps a little disappointingly, after just over two hours. So for me, at least, this product works almost exactly as advertised.

title: I might have mixed it up strong compared to some of the other methods I've seen but after so many years of disappointment I want
body: FINALLY. A kava product that actually reminds me of drinking kava. I grew the stuff for a few years in Hawaii and have always wanted to go back just so I could drink the real stuff again. I've tried various powders and capsules over the years and they were utter nonsense compared to authentic fresh kava.  Never could afford having the frozen fresh stuff shipped over, which can cost 200+ a kilo, but started looking again recently. Decided to go ahead and give Wakacon a try after reading some reviews here and got this stuff in today. Mixed up 4oz(1 1/3 cups) to 48oz of water and coconut water mixed. After the 3rd glass, ALAS!! That warm peaceful glow that only "Liquid Aloha" knows. It's been 12 years or so sense I've last had that kava feeling and am profoundly grateful that this brand actually works. I might have mixed it up strong compared to some of the other methods I've seen but after so many years of disappointment I wanted to make sure it was STRONG. I can't really say this batch was strong compared to the stuff I used to make but it works. I warmed up the coconut water and added it and the kava to a blender to blend for a bit. Then, poured that into a kava cheesecloth I've had for years. Took a while for it to strain through the cheesecloth. I decided to knead it instead through about 12oz of water which helped work all that fine particulate out of the cheesecloth. Poured that stuff in with the rest, and wa la, we have kava. This stuff tasted more "peppery" than "numbing" than what I remember, but after the 3rd 12oz serving of 4, I had to jump on here to let you guys know this stuff is legit. The 4th cup may be overdoing it as I can feel this stuff is actually somewhat strong now after starting to type this. I was going to just give it 4 stars because it isn't the fresh stuff, but starting to feel it's effects more pronounced and reminding me of what I have missed for all these years, Wakacon Kava gets 5 stars. THANK YOU TANK YOU THANK YOU

If you're looking for something natural, I would certainly give Kava a try.  I sometimes have anxiety and I find this is a much better option than taking prescription medications that are addictive and habit forming.  I use it only at night these days and I find it helps me to relax.  It is NOT the kind of root that will get you "high" and I would say the effects are subtle.  I also take Melatonin to help me sleep and again - for me, much more preferable than taking an addictive medication.  There are definitely other good brands out there and I've tried some of them, but way pay twice as much?  The people who sell this also send out an instructional pdf that tells you how to prepare it, etc.  I hope this review helps some people - especially those who are seeking to not have to resort to using addictive medications or drinking alcohol (I don't) but also suffer from stress and anxiety.

title: Pleasantly surprised
body: This was my first time trying kava since taking the pills over 15 years ago (which did nothing) and I have to say I'm pleasantly surprised by the strength of the effects. I was pretty skeptical, since most herbal preparations don't do anything for me, but after doing some research I decided to take a chance on this brand. I would describe the effects as somewhere between a good solid alcohol buzz (but more focused and longer lasting) and a mild dose of Vicodin. I used 4 tbs. of kava powder in a 12 oz. French press with a 50/50 mix of water & soy milk; it gummed up the press and I ended up removing the lid & strainer, sticking my immersion blender in for a whirl then pouring through a fine mesh strainer, pressing with the back of a wooden spoon to squeeze out all of the liquid. I then re-used the same powder for a second batch which I drank about half an hour later and that's when I really started to feel it. The taste is definitely weird but I didn't find it as objectionable as some reviewers did, I just drank it quickly followed by a few ounces of water to get the lingering bitterness out of the back of my throat. Overall the effects were strong enough to be worth the minor hassle of preparing and consuming it, and the price is good compared to other premium kava vendors. I'll definitely be coming back for more!

title: First time with Kava
body: This was my first experience with any Kava and I must say I was very pleased.  I blended two cups of hot but not boiling water with one cup of milk and three heaping tbs of Waka Kava in my Nutribullet for about 3-4 mins (pausing a few times).  I then filtered the substance through a metal kitchen strainer (screen type) and then again through one layer of cheese cloth.  I then added some chocolate sauce and some ice cubes to help cool.  Then I put it in the fridge overnight and all the next day.  The following afternoon when I tried it, it produced a numbing sensation on my lips and tongue right away. I didn't find it as foul as some have said it tastes, but it is strong and I can see where it can take some getting used to.......also very peppery in flavor.  I drank the first 8 oz and waited.  Effects seemed to come on fairly quickly, a very heady buzz combined with relaxation and a sense of contentment.  I then finished the rest and felt extremely comfortable.  The headiness faded a bit and I settled into an overall relaxed state.  I've seen where this product has gotten some poor reviews but thus far (and it is early) I'm very happy with it.  I've also read about the reverse tolerance affect, but this doesn't seem to be happening for me, I felt the affects the first time I tried it.  Very happy with this purchase and would definitely buy again.

title: Meh. Not anything near what I was expecting... Disappointed
body: Meh. I heard really great things about this and finally made the plunge to order after seeing it featured on the show Booze Traveler. I looked up youtube videos on how to take it properly and yadda yadda. A lot of websites and videos made it seem like this stuff was potent and to start with a teaspoon and all kinds of other passive aggressive 'careful how you do this to see how it affects you' jargon. Then upon watching videos, people that visited native countries of this drink were downing bowl after bowl in one first time sitting... so I was conflicted. Tried a heaping teaspoon mixed in like 4oz water. Tongue was a little numb for a couple minutes, nothing noteworthy other than that. I stared into space maybe 13% more than usual, but how I felt was not different (did this with a friend, we had the same experience). I let that sit for an hour with no noteworthy side effects, then said eff it and made a small pitcher and we sipped quite a bit and made it pretty potent. Still didn't do a whole lot. I don't do drugs and have never actually even smoked a cigarette or weed. Occasional couple glasses of wine is all I get down with so I thought that it would be easy for me to identify how this affects my body. Nope. I had higher expectations for this since I visited the Dominican Republic and definitely got a unique experience drinking their native root mix 'mamajuana' so I had assumed this root mixture would have similar properties,despite being a different root I know.... I at least knew it was possible to get a buzz from roots lol... or do something besides numb my tongue for a minute. The crappy part is that studies show kava shouldn't be mixed with alcohol in the same sitting because of how it can affect your kidneys... considering what I was expecting from this stuff and didn't get, I really wanted to just drink instead. I realize nothing would (or did, I caved after being so disappointed expecting a good time) happen from drinking them both in one single night... but still. If you're looking for a euphoric experience, you'll sooner get it from a sugar rush. Just take a shot of rum or something. Or try to get your hands on some authentic mamajuana from the DR. I'll try to finish this giant bag eventually and hope I experience something different. I tried it a total of 3 times so far and have given it to 3 different people who all didn't feel buzzed in any sense. The flavor isn't as bad as people make it out to be. Just taste like gritty muddy water.

I put mine in a single serve blender cup with about a cup of warm water, 1/2 tsp turmeric and a dash of black pepper, then whir it for about a minute, let sit about 5 minutes then whir another minute. Then I strain it with  a little mesh strainer over a cup and add a dash of coconut milk, then chug.  It's not unpleasant, just earthy, it numbs the mouth for about a minute.

title: like approaching your first drink of alcohol
body: If you are someone looking to give KAVA a first try, like approaching your first drink of alcohol, this is the perfect Kava for you.  It is "Mild" Kava but still has plenty of kick and is 100% authentic kava root.  The dosing with this Kava I found that works is this: 2 heaping tablespoons per each 8oz serving of water for a mild/medium effect.  This is what I recommend for a first timer.  Take two heaping tablespoons of the kava powder and put it into the strainer bag (which you should purchase with this Kava)(For two or more people just increase the recipe in the same order (4 heaping teaspoons and 16oz of water etc)).  Then get a nice big deep bowl and pour 8oz of SLIGHTLY WARM (cannot be hot) water into the bowl, then close the strainer bag with you hand and dunk the kava powder into the bowl.  Then for the next 10 minutes VIGOROUSLY squeeze the bag as hard as you can over and over, mushing the stuff around in the bag.  You arm will be tired after doing this for 10 minutes but its all part of the lovely process of Kava.  After this, remove the kava bag and squeeze out the last drops from the bag and put the bag in the sink to be cleaned later.  Now run the kava through a regular metal strainer into a cup and you are finished!

The one drawback to this one is the taste.  Apparently, from doing some reading, there is no such thing as a kava that tastes truly good.  It's kind of a gross tasting thing.  So okay, I get that.  But now that I've had another couple of varieties, I have to say that this was the nastiest tasting of the three, and the effects are about the same all around, so it's not getting you a higher potency just for tasting worse.  I'm going to try another variety from this company, and see how the tastes compare.  I'll leave an update when I get 'round to it.

title: Very relaxing, stops racing thoughts, enjoy life a little more!
body: This was my first experience with Kava and I have to say I'm impressed. After a few shells, I start to feel at ease, my anxiety is reduced, and I'm much more calmer. I suddenly become content with everything and feel more appreciative. The effects from the kavalactones in the kava is what produces this feeling. Although my mind is clear and "sober", my body feels very relaxed. It is a great alternative to sleeping supplements or drugs as it helps you fall asleep afterwards, and you actually get quality sleep compared to supplements, drugs, or even alcohol (so don't drive after drinking Kava, you might fall asleep!). There were times it made me feel spirituality connected to the Earth, other times I feel empathy. I was disappointed the first few weeks as I didn't feel anything most of the time. The whole "reverse tolerance" thing is somewhat true, it took me nearly a month until I started to get consistent positive effects from it. Also, adding milk or nutmilk really helps increase the effects, as well as spending a lot more time squeezing, kneading, and extracting the kavalactones from the kava. The only side effects are that you may feel cold and chilly temporarily during your kava sessions so wearing extra layers is a good idea. And you might feel sick to your stomach if you drink too much or make your kava too strong and also get a very slight hangover if you drink too much of it. This is a good brand. It's certified nobel and you get a bulk amount at a low cost. Highly recommended!

title: A Very Good Product For A Decent Price
body: The term, "Keep the best and ship the rest." certainly applies here... As it does literally throughout the entire islands of the South Pacific, where Kava is grown for tribal and/or commercial use. Legend has it, that the "Mother Root" of the Kava plant has its origins in the island of Vanuatu. From there, cuttings were transported and took on their own certain properties, such as potency, and certain other characteristics of the prepared and processed dried root has... This can vary accordingly, on where and how it is grown, harvested and other aspects of preparation for consumption. Typically, the further southern regions are more potent. Not always of course, but it does seem to be true in my samplings in the last 15-20 years. Also by legend, Kava grown in Papua New Guinea is the most potent variety available... It is also equally scarce and difficult to obtain. Kava is also graded by certain standards. Waka grade Kava is usually a very fine grind, with few if any lateral root remnants in the final harvested process. Such is the case with Wakacon's High Quality Fijian Kava. This Kava from Fiji has a bit of a "bite" to it, which is a common characteristic with most Fijian Kava. It is also light in color... Kava grown in darker soil that is volcanic, will usually have a darker color during the preparation for consumption procedure. Lighter colored Kava does not indicate less potency. White Sands Kava from Tonga, is a good example of being both potent and high quality. This Waka Grade Fijian Kava is also easily prepared for blending instead of time consuming "dunk and squeeze", which can take 5-10 minutes or more, depending on the amount. Letting it soak in water, or coconut milk for about 30 minutes allows the kavalactones to permeate the liquid solution, and then blending on the high speed for about 30-60 seconds and strained through a medium meshed strainer is quite sufficient for use. Whether traditional, or conventional is up to the consumer. "Mainlanders" tend to be impatient, and traditional methods can be rough on the hands. The choice is up to the you. This Kava is good for the inexperienced, or occasional user.

title: Very good stuff
body: Despite some of the very negative reviews, I thought I'd try this as the price was very good and hey, 2 day shipping! Good luck finding that with other kava products without paying through the nose. I prepared this culling from my own techniques and  some of the good tips from other reviewers on this site. I blended 3 tablespoons w/1 cup coconut milk and 2 cups water for about 30 seconds w/my immersion blender. Then I let it sit for an hour. Next, I strained it through some ladies pantyhose and kneaded in a bowl for 5 minutes. Then it was ready to drink. I do microwave mine for about 30 seconds also. That seems to work well. Enjoy, this is a really good deal. I have ordered 3 other kava varieties including Wow!kava Wow!kava could be named not just for the strength but the price point, at 35 dollars for a half pound. It does knock you on your butt though for very little used. Another variety I tried, wasn't ground very much which the company maintained would preserve the kavalactones, but it lost a lot of potency with a standard preparation. I guess if you had a few virgins hanging around, willing to masticate the roots via chewing and spitting, that might work for you :) The other variety was from a herbalist and though the stuff was good, it made you feel slightly ill and like sleeping. Don't get me wrong, this stuff can make you feel a little sick too. Be sure to have water w/a little lemon on hand to sip on for the first hour. How to describe the feeling? I still didn't have the special strainer bag. So I bought some cheese cloth, it worked better, but I did not make enough to get the full benefit, but again afterwards i went back online, read about the multiple washes, using more water, however I had no more product to try it proper. Instructions and or items needed to prepare it should be listed on the product so that you can see it when your purchasing. I feel like I waisted my money, so probably won't purchase again unless I get the other items I need to prepare it correctly. I still really don't know how to prepare it ratio wise, I don't know how many cups you should drink, how many ounces is a cup,shell, or bowl? Are the special bags reusable,  how many times can you wash. I already waisted almost  $40 I would be a fool to buy it again until I have everything I need, so in short I'm very unhappy with the purchase, even a packet of koolaid has instructions and ratios.

It was the consistency of a triple thick milkshake, it had all the needed potentiators, coconut milk, coconut water, Lecthin, and nearly 1/3 LB of Kava finley powdered prior to mixing, straining, and squeezing every last bit of Kava goodness into a 12 oz glass. I drank the entire glass in less than a minute, as it has been suggested that people who appear resistant to the effects of kava may just be sipping the drink all night long, and to get the most out of the drink it should be chugged quickly. Aside from temporary numb mouth and throat, there were no noted effects, no increased relaxation, no mental or physical change whatsoever.  If I had thought it was completely a product issue, I would have given it 1 star,.. but I do think I must have some sort of resistance to Kava's effects in general,.. so I can't really fault the product there.  But be that as it may,.. At the levels I used in my last brew, Regardless of tolerance or resistance to kava, I should have felt something.  At the very least it should have been mildly relaxing or make me a bit sleepy before bed,.. it had zero effect. I have to go with believing this product is a bit weak. I have no bias, and I have no reason to discredit the product, as I really wanted it to work, and went to great lengths to make it work,  it just didn't.  End of story.

I usually take two to three level tablespoons in equal parts of water/milk (6-8 oz. total). I shake up the mixture for a couple minutes in a tumbler, then place it in a coffee press to screen out the Kava powder. title: Meh. Not anything near what I was expecting... Disappointed
body: Meh. I heard really great things about this and finally made the plunge to order after seeing it featured on the show Booze Traveler. I looked up youtube videos on how to take it properly and yadda yadda. A lot of websites and videos made it seem like this stuff was potent and to start with a teaspoon and all kinds of other passive aggressive 'careful how you do this to see how it affects you' jargon. Then upon watching videos, people that visited native countries of this drink were downing bowl after bowl in one first time sitting... so I was conflicted. Tried a heaping teaspoon mixed in like 4oz water. Tongue was a little numb for a couple minutes, nothing noteworthy other than that. I stared into space maybe 13% more than usual, but how I felt was not different (did this with a friend, we had the same experience). I let that sit for an hour with no noteworthy side effects, then said eff it and made a small pitcher and we sipped quite a bit and made it pretty potent. Still didn't do a whole lot. I don't do drugs and have never actually even smoked a cigarette or weed. Occasional couple glasses of wine is all I get down with so I thought that it would be easy for me to identify how this affects my body. Nope. I had higher expectations for this since I visited the Dominican Republic and definitely got a unique experience drinking their native root mix 'mamajuana' so I had assumed this root mixture would have similar properties,despite being a different root I know.... I at least knew it was possible to get a buzz from roots lol... or do something besides numb my tongue for a minute. The crappy part is that studies show kava shouldn't be mixed with alcohol in the same sitting because of how it can affect your kidneys... considering what I was expecting from this stuff and didn't get, I really wanted to just drink instead. I realize nothing would (or did, I caved after being so disappointed expecting a good time) happen from drinking them both in one single night... but still. If you're looking for a euphoric experience, you'll sooner get it from a sugar rush. Just take a shot of rum or something. Or try to get your hands on some authentic mamajuana from the DR. I'll try to finish this giant bag eventually and hope I experience something different. I tried it a total of 3 times so far and have given it to 3 different people who all didn't feel buzzed in any sense. The flavor isn't as bad as people make it out to be. Just taste like gritty muddy water.

I took a pill at 1:30 got the shakes in about 3 hours later started drinking this powder, the shakes and sickness went away. I tried stopping birth control (after 6 years) 4 months ago and ended up developing cystic acne, so I freaked out and went back on birth control. Fast forward 2 months later-- tried going off it again and this time, I wanted to prepare myself for the hormonal flux. I drank this tea 2-3 times a day for a month and when my period finally came around-- mind you I had severe nausea from the hormones, loss of appetite and extreme fatigue from going off the pill. Despite all those side effects of stopping the pill, I had my first normal period (4 days instead of 9) in 6 years, i didn't have a huge acne breakout and no crying spells! Super great results and expecting the bad side effects of the pill to go away in a couple months... cheers to hormone free, holistic health and hope you find healing as well!

It is good for when I need to wake up and is awesome with a little bit of cream. I often have this when I need a pick-me-up at work. There are sayings on each of the tea tabs, which are kind of like fortune cookie fortunes. Sometimes they are nice, but most of the time they are kind of condescending. I do like that each bag is individually wrapped, so it doesn't collect dust or dirt if I get sidetracked before I can make my tea.

title: A must have during your moon cycle!
body: Really works! This is a well researched and well balanced combination of herbs. The key ingredients are red raspberry leaf (amazing), dong quai and vitex - all great women herbs. Also included is calming chamomile and warming cinnamon & ginger. You might need to use 2 tea bags and drink fairly frequently but its indespensable. Its also worth exploring their plain

title: Works well.
body: This tea really works well. It also is very nice tasting. I really enjoy the flavor of this tea. It has a spicy yet sweet aftertaste. It has helped me with some kidney issues.

title: Great variety in each pack
body: Great variety in each pack and you do save some money buying the bigger pack. Some types taste better than others but they are all full of good-for-you herbs so we drink them all. And we haven't gotten sick, but that could also be due to our good hand hygiene and not having kids in the house! We always drink this and EmergenC.

title: Amazingly delicious!

At first, I was skeptical to try this because I absolutely hate black licorice and thought it may have that same taste. However, complete opposite...I LOVE it and am absolutely obsessed. The blend of licorice, mint, and herbs is the perfect combination. When it hits the back of your throat, it's like...ZING! Happiness!

title: This could very well be the reason...
body: It's my first review on Amazon, and I made sure to remember to write it, despite having my hands full with the newborn, since I believe this tea was the reason why I had the labor and delivery I had. 33 year old first time mom, I must have read 15 books in preparation and packed all sorts of massaging and relaxation tools in my hospital bag, hoping for the natural unmedicated birth. My somewhat painful contractions started around 9:30pm. I was prepared for the long night ahead at home. Well, by 11:30 I had to wake my husband up to go to the hospital. Once we arrived, medical personnel somewhat took their time to admit me. Guess what, when they checked I was 8.5 dilated and ready to push 20 minutes later. 7 pound baby was born at 3:24am after 6 pushes, without any pain meds. According to my husband he flew out like a rocket. And did I mention it was actually on his due date. It must be the tea, since my mom was in labor with her first for over 20 hours, same as I expected for myself. Seven days later I'm drinking it to help my body heal. Don't get me wrong, labor still hurt like nothing I've felt before, but it was fast and a very profound experience. Highly recommend!

I started drinking this tea in November and have had a period every month since! They are not 28 days apart yet, but I had one in December, January, February and March. I finally feel like a "regular woman again!

title: It is truly amazing and balancing when used as directed on the package
body: I have been drinking this tea for a month.  1 cup daily starting during my period, then on day 12 (2 cups a day) then on day 23, 2-3 cups a day.  This has completely DONE AWAY WITH MY HOT FLASHES!!!  No more perimenopause symptoms, no joke.  A lot of our hormonal issues are due to estrogen fluctuations during the month.  This tea contains low level phytoestrogens that - when your hormones are too high- bring them down, and if they are too low, it fills in the gaps so your body doesn't panic - doing away with symptoms brought on by hormonal highs and lows.  Because of this tea, I stopped using the progesterone cream that I had been on for a year.  As a result, I lost 10 pounds, my skin cleared, and I don't get depressed the last half of the month - even sleeping 7 hours a night, with no night sweats- this stuff works miracles.  This tea gave me my life back.  Thank you yogi tea for researching this blend.  It is truly amazing and balancing when used as directed on the package!!!  5 plus stars!!!

title: Almost as delicious as sweet victory.
body: Oh my gosh I love this tea. I will drink this over almost anything else. Except the blood of my enemies. I'll take a warm, tall glass of that any day.

title: Excellent Product
body: This tea is fantastic. For as long as I remember, I've suffered from terrible cramps, jitters, and other unpleasant PMS symptoms. This tea knocks them right out. I also have a general increase in energy since I started drinking it, and have reduced my coffee intake to just one cup daily because of it.

title: Helps with Hormonal Acne
body: I am in my late 20s and struggled for years with hormonal acne breakouts that were clearly tied to my cycle. In Jan. 2012, I was at my wit's end with topical treatments and altered my diet to see if it would help.

I hope after the suggested 30 days, she is much better and back to her old self.

title: UPDATE: great taste, hoping for just as great results

Seems to have plenty of ingredients that health reviews agree are supposed to be good for what this tea is claiming to do - enhance the function of your mind and memory. I suffer from terrible memory, and while it is too early to tell, i am going to continue drinking this (alternating with Brain Booster tea) for the next 3-6 months, as it definitely cannot hurt, and if nothing else, is delicious. I will try to update after 3-6 months.

title: Water broke at 3:15am, had baby after only a few pushes at 5am!!!!  THIS TEA WORKS. !!!
body: Took this tea starting 36 weeks pregnant - drank 3 tall cups a day (two bags in each tall cup). By my 37 week checkup I was 2 cent. dialated and fully effaced! My labor started when my water broke at 3:15am when I was 38 weeks, I steeped a VERY strong potion of the raspberry tea and drank it right after my water broke (as I had read that this is where the magic of its power works!). I had an instant urge to push while gathering our stuff to get headed to the hospital. Hubby drove 90 mph down the highway hoping I wouldn't have the baby in the car. I got to the hospital, pushed only a handful of times and baby was born at 5am!!!!!!!! THIS TEA WORKS. Period. Truly believe the magic is in that strong potion during early labor though.! :):)  Side note:  Also really helped get my uterus back into shape, and also it doubled my milk supply to nurse.

body: I really like this tea.  It has a naturally sweet taste without the use of any added sweeteners.  (There are no artifical sweeteners added to this tea.  Check out the complete ingredients list shown in the Label Information area.)

title: Yogi Tea, Calm Bedtime
body: As an individual who has difficulty falling asleep, I have tried a number of natural products to make it easier to fall asleep. A friend recommended Yogi Bedtime Tea and I have found that it works well for me. I also found that it is wise for me to get in bed and drink it there, it works that well for me.

title: Tea for a coffee lover
body: My wife and I both love coffee, and tea to a lesser extent. I've realized over the years that my preference for coffee is largely due to two factors: the strength of the flavor, and the 'thickness' of the drink. This is one of the few teas that rivals coffee in both departments. That's not to say it tastes anything like coffee--it is strong and aromatic, but sweet and almost nutty, not acidic or tending towards bitter. The hazelnut and vanilla flavors mingle quite nicely in this dark, expressive tea. Yogi makes some really fine teas, including this one.

title: Outstanding Tea
body: This has become one of my favorite teas - it is a delicious, smooth blend that requires no sugar. My husband even likes it. We've also found it to be an exceptional immune system booster. We've tried many different brands of echinacea capsules many times over the years, but this tea seems to be especially potent and quick-acting - maybe because it's a blend of 3 species of echinacea, and also includes astragalus & elderberry. It's a very enjoyable way to do something good for your body!

title: Love the tea

I am sensitive to caffeine, so it's a must. I'll let you read the box for the ingredients, but I think the cinnamon really makes this tea; it gives you a subtle sense that the tea is sweetened without actually putting in sweetener.

body: This is the perfect tea to drink to relax you before bedtime.  When I drink this I sleep thru the entire night and wake up feeling rested.  Love this bedtime tea.

Licorice is naturally sweeter than sugar so quells all those cravings.

title: Drinking for Two: My Cyst and I
body: I started drinking this religiously when I was diagnosed last fall with a large solid ovarian cyst (apple size). The doctors can't pick a diagnosis (dermoid, chocolate, hemorragic, endometriodoma), and I can't afford so many scans/tests without an answer. So I googled, and to give myself a false sense of control, ordered a case of Moon Cycle tea, a kettle, and a case of honey. Taking my ovary in my own hands, if you will.

title: Howling for joy!
body: As any woman going through monthly cramps knows, the pain and irritability turn you into a crazed werewolf. That's why this tea is so appropriately named. This fennel concoction is so potent that I use one bag for three teas. The blend of herbs, especially the ginger, is very warming and soothing. I still have to take heavy duty pain killers, but this new addition soothes the edginess and constant growling :)

title: great mental boost
body: Like all Yogi teas I use, this is another winnter!  I am definitely more focused and energized after a cup of this.  I hope this company never stops making teas.  I have in pantry their teas for stress relief, blues away, muscle & joint, detox, energy... all of them very effective.  I am saving money on chiropractor and who knows what other costly medical treatment recommended by conventional medicine and I don't have to be concerned about what I am putting in my system.  If you are not convinced about the healing powers of Nature, these teas may well change your mind!

title: YOGI STOMACH EASE TEA
body: This tea is great for nausea, or any stomach discomfort.  One cup and I feel great.  I add a little honey and some lemon for flavor, but the results are fantastic.

body: This tea is exactly as described and actually super yummy! I drank it through this pregnancy, just had my baby and the doctors have all said he is a perfect baby. Satisfied and would recommend to a friend.

body: I read somewhere a review where they described it as peppery - no ginger - just strong.  I would say to that --- they do not really like a ginger tea.  Maybe that person is used to a blend. title: Helps curb my appetite for sweets
body: My favorite tea!  It has a natural sweetness which curbs my desire for sugar in the evenings, helping me to loose weight naturally.

title: Better than prescription sleeping aids
body: I drink this tea about one hour before I plan to go to bed. title: Just OK for me

title: BEST TEA EVER!!
body: I have ordered this item 3 times and plan to keep ordering it. I am a HUGE chai tea fan and was looking for something different. I have introduced many of my friends to this product and they have been buying it as well. You would think that I was marketing it, thats how much I believe in it. I even stopped drinking coffee! title: Throat tea helps my sore throats possibly caused by acid reflux...
body: I drink this tea every morning mixed with another tea (green). I have trouble throughout the year with sore throats. The doctors say I have acid reflux but I am trying to control it with dietary changes. At least I'm in style, since the president was supposedly diagnosed too. I decided not to take the meds the doctor suggested for a while to see if I could handle it less aggressively for now and without side effects. The tea has helped my throat. It feels better immediately after drinking. This is not scientific. It could be something else helping my throat. But for now, I'll keep drinking it and see. In winter, the hoarseness and raspiness, congestion, itchiness, need to clear throat gets worse generally, but has improved since lifestyle changes in the last few years.  (I saw an ENT & RESPIRATORY SPECIALIST about this condition.) I was happy to find this tea and glad to have the pack of six. So I'm adding this to my regime. I will be ordering more. I like to combine excellent medical care with common sense, healthy living and natural healing methods.

title: If you like the Aveda calming tea, read this review!
body: I bought this tea because I love the Aveda calming tea, and several of the reviews said it was very similar.  I was also concerned because several reviews said the mint was way too strong.  The directions say to steep the tea for 5-10 minutes.  If you do that, you will get a VERY strong mint flavor and it is overwhelming (not like the tea from the salon).  I tried it twice, once I left it about 10 minutes and the second I left it at least 5 minutes (possibly more).  So I tried it again but only let it steep for about 3 minutes and it is MUCH better.  The flavor is more mild and the flavors meld together better.  I might even try it a little less (maybe two minutes) as I really like more subtle tea. Obviously you can't beat the price, and if you play around with the times, you will get something similar to the Aveda calming tea for a much better price.

body: This is my favorite ginger tea and I have tried them all! I have slow digestion and this tea really eases the nausea after meals. I am very grateful to be able to buy it in large quantities from Amazon subscribe & save!

body: I really like this tea - the taste just appeals to me.  I have no idea if it helps with mood, but generally drink a cup a day.  The bags are individually sealed to keep it fresh, buying it on Amazon is easy, and I like the package of 6 boxes.

title: Love it!!!
body: I love this tea.  I was skeptical to try it because i hate black licorice.  My husband doesn't drink tea and he really likes the flavor of this.  This is so much cheaper than buying at a grocery store, and i never know if the store will have this flavor.  I will purchase this again.

title: Try it!
body: This is my third order of this lovely tea.  Everyone I serve it to wants to know where they can get some.  I served it to my daughter and now even her kids love it (ages five, eight, and eleven).  So I sent some to her, too.  Be sure to get the Licorice Mint and not just the plain Licorice.  The mint gives it an extra dimension.  Even my friends who are hardcore tea drinkers love it.

title: Drinking for Two: My Cyst and I
body: I started drinking this religiously when I was diagnosed last fall with a large solid ovarian cyst (apple size). The doctors can't pick a diagnosis (dermoid, chocolate, hemorragic, endometriodoma), and I can't afford so many scans/tests without an answer. So I googled, and to give myself a false sense of control, ordered a case of Moon Cycle tea, a kettle, and a case of honey. Taking my ovary in my own hands, if you will.

title: The Perfect Chai
body: I'm really picky about the chai tea I drink, and Yogi is the perfect cup of tea. I was very pleased to find it here in bulk - Trader Joe's seems to have ceased selling it. Apparently it was "too spicy" (this is what I found out from a friend's husband who works at one of the TJ's warehouses). To me, it's a perfect blend of heady spices, and it's not too overwhelming.

title: Great for water weight removal
body: I love this tea. It helps me with bloat. It tastes ok with sugar. I like the taste but I can imagine it's not everyone's cup of tea.

title: It works well!
body: I have very serious period cramps problem. I have to take painkillers every time to stop me from kicking pillows and rolling on my bed. SInce I've been taking painkillers for many years, I was looking for a healthier natural solution than chemical painkillers. I found this product, read some reviews and decided to give it a try. Last month, I drank lots of this tea during my period- about 5-6 tea bags a day, and to my surprise, I experienced my first period without pain in many years! It also reduced my tiredness. I don't like the taste too much(I added lots of honey) but I don't care because the effect is satisfying and it's natural! : )  Love this product!!!

title: Our absolute favorite ginger tea
body: Our absolute favorite ginger tea. Spicy, flavorful, long-lasting (I get two or three steeps out of each bag). HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. I have not taken an antacid in over ten years. Ginger tea aids in digestion improve circulation, clears my dry wintery phlegm. I order these tea bags again and again. With this bulk pricing, I never have to make a special run to the store; I always buy from Amazon.

title: The tea itself taste good but as a new tea drinker I did not ...
body: 6 boxes with 16 tea bags in each box - I could not pass up the deal.  The tea itself taste good but as a new tea drinker I did not commit to drinking it everyday otherwise I would have been able experience it better.  So with that, 4 stars for quantity and taste.

title: Delicious tea that needs nothing added except hot water!
body: This is the most delicious tea!  It has a complex bouquet of flavors and includes enough natural sweetness that no other sweeteners need to be added. My husband, who loves his sugar, was pleasantly surprised that he did not feel a need to add any to this tea. It is warmly satisfying and helps me through the rare days that I am fasting. I find that I can make 2-3 cups of tea from each bag-just need to steep longer if reused, and even after that, it does a nice job of adding a subtle flavor to my ice water.

title: Contains ingredients that irritate stomach
body: I bought this recently to help with gastritis symptoms. After it arrived and I drank it a few times, I noticed to my surprise that it would actually create mild gastric stress in the form of gas build-up in my stomach and burps. Further investigation revealed that one of the ingredients is "Organic Black Pepper". This is an odd choice for a "Stomach Ease" tea, since people with any kind of acidity problems are supposed to avoid spicy ingredients like Pepper. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone with acidity issues such as gastritis, ulcers, GERD, etc.

title: Good for menstral migraines!
body: This tea has worked miricles!  For at least 6 years I have had migraines associated with my period. I reacted to the perscription migraine meds.  As the years past, the severity of the headaches increased as well as the duration.  I have taken this tea the last two months and only had a very minor migraine the first month- none the second- which has never happened in years. I drink cup every other day when I'm not on my period, then increase it to 1 to 2 cups a day the week before.  Then the week of my period I drink 2 to 3 cups a day.

title: Five Stars
body: It is an excellent alternative of miralax for me. I have severe constipation and it helps a lot.

title: definately a keeper for me.
body: I've taken anti-depressants for years and they get so expensive that I gave this stuff a try last year. First used as 'backup', after few months backed off the meds (w/Dr.'s ok) every other day, all the while having 2-3 cups of this each day. (I drink ALOT of tea). Now I'm on subscribe and save and drink this tea, hot or cold, no sugar, regularly. It's got a nice pleasant taste, hot or cold.

title: Helpful but Wretched Taste
body: This was quite helpful in relieving my sore throat and helping me fight a bad cold. However, every single flavor has a VERY strong (and to me, rather off-putting) licorice taste. If you don't love licorice, I'd recommend getting Yogi's Green Tea Trip Echinacea, which does NOT have the same flavor. I wish I had gotten that brand, actually!

title: They say this preps you for a speedy labor... I am proof!
body: I drank the “Earth Mama Angel Baby - Organic Third Trimester Tea” brand of for most of my pregnancy. Starting at about 9/10weeks and into the 3rd tri. I switched to this Yogi brand red raspberry leaf tea my third trimester because the Earth Mama Angel was out of stock. I enjoyed the flavor of this Yogi brand one a little better. They both were very tasty iced. Some women say its better with honey but I didn’t mind it plain. My midwife suggested 1 cup per day during the 1st trimester, 2cups 2nd, 3cups 3rd… Both teas are very mild and I found both tasty – they are both an excellent price to buy in bulk.

title: Great taste!
body: I've tried other detox tea with a bitter taste and a slightly foul smell. These teas actually taste really good and there is no unpleasant odor. Be prepared to run to the restroom often if you have a cup. A def repurchase.

title: Great For Painful Periods!
body: I love this tea.Quite honestly, it is the only thing that makes my beautiful monthly gift bearable. I have found that when I drink this tea two weeks before my period at least 2 cups per day the first week and 3-4 cups a day the week before my period that I am (almost) cramp free! I still get some fatigue before my period but my mood is also better. When i dont use this tea I am bedridden at least one day every mont in pain from my cramping. I know its kind of high maintenance to remember to drink the tea and to drink it so often but it sure as hell beats another bad period  I usually only have to take 1-2 midol the first day of my cycle instead of my prescribed medication. Thats saying a lot. Buy this in bulk and keep it on hand if you have painful periods like me, you wont regret it.

title: This tea keeps me from bloating....awesome tea!!!
body: I am doing my natural thing and not buying any overcounter medications and I am not on any presc. meds. I know when I use to be on my period I used to take a motrin or midol. I had headaches and bad cramps, the medication did take some pain away but not all you know it just suppress the pain.

title: Great for Hormonal Acne
body: This has really helped with my hormonal acne.  Since I've been drinking two cups everyday, I no longer get acne (at all).  It's definitely a great alternative to birth control pills.  Now the taste isn't that pleasing but I don't mind especially since it has cleared my skin.

title: Seriously impressive
body: I'm an active woman in my late twenties with no other physical problems apart from severe PMS/PMDD (symptoms including 3-4 day long migraines, fatigue and body pain, skin rashes and emotional upsets). I started drinking 2-3 cups of this tea (single-strength) about a month ago and noticed a HUGE improvement in symptoms- going from that laundry list above to a few hours of fatigue and a headache is enough to make me stick to this in the long term. Just to add, this list doesn't include cramping so I can't say whether it would help with that.. though I imagine it might.

title: Heavenly taste and beautiful aroma. Warming, sweet, chocolatey, cinnamony
body: I purchased a case of this tea a while ago and now am finishing up my last box and about to reorder.  This tea is so good I regularly put a few packets in a purse or my backpack so that I can enjoy some when I am not at home. The aroma is heavenly - cinnamony, chocolatey, spicy, beautiful. The flavor is delicate but bold, and this tea is so sweet by itself that I find I do not need to add any sugar or sweetening. I previously drank a lot of milk and would put milk in this tea -- it is very good that way but not necessary.

title: Love it!
body: I love this tea, it is so yummy and I love that it is organic.  And, it is cheaper than buying Raspberry Leaf tea at the store.  Plus, I can't find Raspberry Leaf anywhere buy health food stores or Whole Foods, so it is nice to get it on Amazon.  I was paying $5 or more for a box of tea.  This tea is supposed to help with female reproduction and toning the uterus, which is why I drink it all day long.

Thank you Yogi Tea you have given me my life back!

title: Yogi teas are pretty awesome. The cold season blend is by far ...
body: Yogi teas are pretty awesome. The cold season blend is by far the best tea blend I've ever used to ameliorate my constant sinus problems. Use two bags, let it steep under pressure for 10 minutes, and it works as good if not better than prescription decongestant medicine, antibiotics and nasal steroids. When I get sick with a bad sinus infection, I'll fill a 2 liter air pot with 8 bags of this stuff and quaff it all day long. Sometimes, this works well enough to get me over the thing by the very next day, assuming I sleep well that night and take it easy all day. If not, I'll almost always be at least good enough to return to work. There are some herbs in here that definitely have a decongestant effect, and others that clearly have a very potent antinflammatory effect, which I'm sure involves the downregulation of the inflammatory infiltrates almost every allergy and sinus suffer has tons of in their upper respiratory mucosa. Brewed strong, this tea is the closest thing I've found to an instant cure for the common cold or any other kind of upper respiratory tract infection. I just wish they sold it loose leaf, because I'd buy it by the pound.

Seems to get me tired about 3-5 hours later, when I would otherwise be wired and wide awake if I didn't have any. I've also found that on nights I forget to make or drink it at that time, once I do finally guzzle it down, it seems to take affect in the same time frame. With that said, it seems to work pretty quickly on my wife, who as mentioned in a review for another tea, could fall asleep on lava rocks in seconds. In any event, ignoring the initial scent, it's a pretty tasty tea and does seem to help, but takes a little longer on me.

body: I ordered this tea to help with bad periods. I have painful cramps and I feel very prone to migraines throughout the week of my period. I can tell when I feel prone to migraines, my head/scalp, neck and left eye feel a certain way and I can just feel I need to be careful or I'll get one. I always feel very close to getting a migraine during the week of my period. Drinking the 2 cups of this tea each day this week has done wonders, it greatly diminished or totally got rid of my pre-migraine symptoms, and I had virtually no cramps as well. The only drawback is I really dislike the taste of the tea and the smell. I think it's the fennel in it. So I just try to chug it down and eat something afterwards to remove the taste.

body: I drink this tea every morning mixed with another tea (green). I have trouble throughout the year with sore throats. The doctors say I have acid reflux but I am trying to control it with dietary changes. At least I'm in style, since the president was supposedly diagnosed too. I decided not to take the meds the doctor suggested for a while to see if I could handle it less aggressively for now and without side effects. The tea has helped my throat. It feels better immediately after drinking. This is not scientific. It could be something else helping my throat. But for now, I'll keep drinking it and see. In winter, the hoarseness and raspiness, congestion, itchiness, need to clear throat gets worse generally, but has improved since lifestyle changes in the last few years.  (I saw an ENT & RESPIRATORY SPECIALIST about this condition.) I was happy to find this tea and glad to have the pack of six. So I'm adding this to my regime. I will be ordering more. I like to combine excellent medical care with common sense, healthy living and natural healing methods.

body: Having tried many (all?) other peppermint teas, Yogi's Purely Peppermint is, hands-down, my favorite. No strange after-taste, with a fresh, smooth, not-overpowering peppermint flavor. I order packages of 6 boxes, because this is my go-to iced-tea drink during Phoenix's very hot, very long summers! It's so refreshing and thirst-quenching, I can drink it all day long since it's caffeine-free and made with organic peppermint leaves. Two tea bags make an wonderful quart of iced-tea... add a little Stevia, and you will get rave reviews like I get. Not too strong, not too weak, just right! I should note that I find some teas are better served cold, others hot, and in my opinion, this one is not nearly as good when served hot.
