body: This tea is good for pregnancy and the health of women's reproductive system. Besides the health benefits, the tea tastes great. It reminds of aromatic black tea with some freshness from the raspberry fruit. I drink it every day and sometime add milk or half&half, either way it tastes great.

title: This stuff is great!
body: I drink one tea bag daily and it works wonders for me. My complexion is clearer and i feel lighter. This tea eliminates bloating for me. Initially I was not a fan of the taste. It's spicy in a pumpkin spice cinnamon type of way, which I'm not a fan of, but after drinking it a few more times I don't mind the taste at all anymore. Also, this is not a laxative but it will make you poop regularly and it will not be pretty. At least that's been my experience. I love it though, I can see how it's releasing the toxins from my body and the change in my appearance and how I feel, and this is from drinking only one cup of tea per day. I highly recommend this tea and have already put on a coworker, my husband and a friend to this tea. A+!

title: Breathe Deep is my favorite tea
body: This tea is fantastic.  The main flavor is licorice - with other herbal undertones and it is my favorite tea of all.  I had to buy the six pack because I run through a single pack so fast.

title: Yogi Ginger Tea
body: This is my go to tea instead of pain relievers. It works wonders for me. The tea is strong and I usually use the same bag twice. Unfortunately, I get hot flashes if I drink it for multiple days in a row (which I do monthly).  The same thing happens when I make tea using ginger root. The ginger root helps, but this blend works much better for me as far as fighting pain and fatigue.

title: Awful taste
body: I only used it a few times so I really didn't see a difference.  I just couldn't stand the taste of this tea, even while holding my breath it was AWFUL. The aftertaste didn't help either.

title: Great blend! Everyone I know who tries this loves ...
body: Great blend! Everyone I know who tries this loves it. I have brought a few boxes into the office and they didn't last long. Especially great around flu season. Whether it really boosts your immune system who knows. I just enjoy a cup of this from time to time.

title: Fantastic flavor!
body: I can't believe how much I like the flavor of this tea!  It is delicious. The only drawback that I have seen about it, is that it seems to leave my throat a little dry for singing compared to a licorice flavor that seems to coat my throat.  If you mix a bag of this chai with the Yogi Egyptian Licorice, what a great combination!

title: Great alternative to coffee
body: I love this tea and drink it every morning before work. It's  one of the best tasting tea's I've had and I think it helps to bring you clarity without the stimulant effect of caffeine. Yogi always does such a great job of making flavors that are complex without being overpowering!

title: I started drinking this to help treat my debilitating menstrual ...
body: I started drinking this to help treat my debilitating menstrual cramps. With only 2 cups of tea a day just prior to and during my period, my cramps vanished!

title: Delicious
body: I love the taste and the different combination of spices.  It will wake up all your senses.  You can drink with or without added sugar.  I actually use 2 tea bag in a large cup.

title: This stuff is incredible
body: Works as decongestant, expectorant and to stop asthma for me. Three weeks ago, I caught a bad flu - two weeks of upper respiratory 'fun' but this stuff helps a lot.  Then I gave the flu to my boyfriend.  He was just a little hesitant to think this could help, but after one cup asks for it regularly.  He has some first thing in the morning, and additionally takes 3-4 tea bags to work with him.

title: Warm. Sweet. Comforting.
body: I am addicted to this tea!  It is a great sweet treat after dinner or whenever you really want something sweetly comforting.  This is the 2nd time I have purchased the 6 box set and will most probably purchase again when I run out.

title: Great quick fix
body: Great quick fix for me when I have a migraine or indigestion.  Not as strong as I would like, but it gets me by.  I like to make my own if I have ginger root at home.

title: Tastes good, doesn't seem to help me with bed time
body: Tastes good, doesn't seem to help me with bed time, but it is a great bed time drink.  It tastes sweeter than I would like, especially since I'm pretty sensitive to sugar before going to bed.

title: Absolutely Love It
body: I have been using this for a few months now to calm the premenstrual cramps and other not so pleasant symptoms of pms. I think it works very well, and it tastes good too:) I actually looked up the herbs that were a part of this blend and found that not only was it helping my premenstrual symptoms but it was great for my skin, my immune system, and my digestive system. So now I try and drink at least a cup a day and I definitely feel better when I do. I do still experience cramps when I drink this, but it's not nearly as intense (I get them pretty bad) I recommend this to any woman who dreads that time of the month and is also looking for a great product that they can rely on.

title: I love this tea, it's so good!
body: This is really great tea.  Very, very good.  I am usually the type of person who HATES warm tea, but this stuff is definitly the exception.  I love it.  I make several cups of it a day with 1 - 2 small teasoons of honey.  It's also great without honey.  The Yogi "Woman's Energy" tea is also great too, with a lot of the same ingredients in it.  I am so glad that I gave this tea a chance, I really, really like it.  You should drink 2 - 3 cups a day through out the month and 4 - 5 cups a day during your cycle.  Which is pretty easy to do because it is so good.  I keep a tea kettle on the stove with hot water on my warming unit so I cane make tea through out the day.  You should steep the tea 5 - 10 min but if you forget about it and steep it longer it doesn't taste bitter or gross.  I haven't had this tea long enough to see any benifits from it yet, but I will update my review later.  I look forward to trying their other teas.

title: Very relaxing effect
body: I drink this every night before bed and it really does relax me and help me fall asleep.  It has a little bit of sweetness and overall quite delcious. I definitely recommend this to anyone who is high strung and whose mind moves a mile a minute.

title: Yogi Egyptian Licorice
body: This is my favorite herbal tea.  It has a slight sweetness from the licorice and the flavor is bold enough to compare with coffee.

title: Can really notice when I am not drinking it
body: I have had hormone problems in the past couple of years and after getting them tested and realizing they are way out of balance I went looking for natural products to help.

title: I believe It absolutely helps regulate my hormones!
body: I have been drinking about two cups of this tea for over a year. I believe It absolutely helps regulate my hormones! Hormonal cystic acne is lessened, breast tenderness isn't as bad, and my flow is also shorter and lighter. I don't really like the taste, but the benefits far outweigh it!!

title: Very refreshing!
body: Even though the title says Joint Comfort, I love this tea for it's refreshing minty green tea taste!  I drink regularly just because it tastes so good!

title: Delicious and works well
body: This tea is very delicious and actually does make me feel less stressed. It also has kava which makes some people tired, so it's great before bed.

title: Tasty and soothing!
body: This tea smells and tastes really amazing. It is very flavorful (almost reminds me of Chai). It is actually very soothing for an upset stomach or any pains that come along with your monthly hormone changes.

title: My favorite, but can be hard to find locally
body: This makes delicious hot tea in winter and iced in the warm months...I used to buy the Aveda licorice mint tea, but was so happy to discover this much more affordable option. Amazon has a great price with subscribe and save. I have a hard time finding it in our local stores so I'm very happy to buy from Amazon.

title: Two Glasses Every Night Make for Worry Free Sleep
body: I absolutely love this tea.  I have been drinking two glasses of it every night for almost a year.  I have had trouble sleeping for years and have suffered from anxiety and depression since I was a teenager.  Two glasses of this before bed and an hour or so later I am calm and ready for sleep.  I also do not wake up in the middle of the night with racing thoughts and worries as I used to.  I combine this with 1 Holy Basil supplement pill every night as well and it's my dream nightly combo.  Great deal trough Amazon considering it's $5 per box in stores.

title: a bit on the minty side
body: Purchased this product because I love licorice and tea. After finishing my box of Yogi bedtime tea (which has great licorice flavor) I thought I would branch out a bit. This tea is decent but I can barely taste this licorice due to the mint (almost too minty at times). Still, it is a good tea but not quite what I was hoping for.

title: Love It!
body: I love this tea!  The taste is unique and I feel that it may be a taste that one needs to grow accustomed to.  It has helped the continual heartburn after coming off omeprizole.

title: This black licorice tasting tea is DELICIOUS!! Whether ...
body: This black licorice tasting tea is DELICIOUS!!  Whether it actually helps me with my fasts or not, I'm not really sure.... but perhaps there's a placebo affect ;)  This tea is always on my shelf.

title: Very helpful for me
body: I tried this and the Traditional Medicinals and this was a lot more helpful to me.  The flavor and smell of this tea seemed more intense and concentrated compared to TM.  I have very, very low production and this tea helped me increase my production from 4 oz to 6-7 oz daily.  I drink 3-4 times a day.

title: This tea makes me feel good and gives me energy
body: This tea makes me feel good and gives me energy.  No side effect even with several cups a day.

title: tasty tea!
body: I really like the taste of it and thinking it might help having an easier birth makes it motivating to drink tea even in the summertime. It contains a lot of Mint, so this is what is determining the taste, it's fresh and nice!

title: Great price
body: Amazon offers the best price out there for this product. I haven't experienced any cramping that people have mentioned. I started drinking this tea twice a day when I was 34 weeks pregnant. Right now I'm at 38 weeks and really don't know if it works. I guess I can update my review about the efficiency of this product after I deliver!

title: Absolutely delicious tea
body: They really need to change the name of this product. "Throat Comfort" sounds so medicinal, which is NOT how it tastes. I recommend "Licorice Dream" or "Fennel Fantasy". Absolutely delicious.

title: Light gingery flavor, good afternoon pick me up
body: I enjoy a cup of this most afternoons when I want a hot drink but no caffeine. I like to steep my teabag for a minute or so to get a fuller flavor. It actually picks me up, the light ginger taste is pleasant. I like buying the 6-box pack as its very good value. I can take a box to work and leave it in my drawer. Have been buying this for a couple of years.

title: This stuff is great for relaxing but I'd still like to try pure ...
body: I heard about Kava in a Tim Ferris podcast. I think Kevin Rose was taking about Kava bars in His area. This stuff is great for relaxing but I'd still like to try pure kava. This is a blend buts it's still a great before bed drink.

title: I cant say enough good things about Yogi tea
body: I cant say enough good things about Yogi tea. The Chai Roobios and DeTox are my two most favorite. Chai Roobios has the right blend of spices to make you feel rejuvenated and calm. Roobios tea is probably one of the few that is safe during pregnancy as well and it helps to relieve nausea.

title: Yum. Love it iced with lemon. 36 weeks pregnant.
body: I ordered this tea after reading the benefits of raspberry leaf tea and toning the uterus. Like I said, I am 36 weeks pregnant and just started drinking this stuff. I tried it hot at first and thought it was just ok. It tastes like regular hot tea, earthy/black tea/a little bitter. I didn't particularly like it. But then I tried it iced and added some lemon. Now I'm addicted! Love it! I'm curious to know if it's possible to drink too much of the stuff. Can't get enough. (I think if I were to drink it hot I might try the Yogi Women's Mother to Be Tea, because of the mint in it). I usually make a large pot at night (64 ounces w/ 11 tea bags) I let it steep overnight. In the morning I pour it over ice, add lemon and drink it throughout the day.

title: less cocoa taste than expected
body: Pleasant tasting but I thought it would be chocolatier from other reviews.I won't buy again. The chai from Yogi is great though.

title: Yogi Tea Chai Green, 16-count pkg, six boxes inside
body: Yogi Tea is always a favorite for me, especially during the winter months. This is a strong flavored green tea, caffeinated, a warm Rich Spice Chai Tea. Add honey, lemon, or drink as is you will be delighted with this tea.

title: Cramps Eased
body: I bought this tea after Google'ing remedies for easing menstrual cramps.  I have had painful periods since I was 11 years old and I am now 24.  I began drinking this tea 2 days before my period was expected, drinking about 3 cups/day.  The taste is different, but you get used to it.

title: one hour after dinner better so the tea can work out when you sleep
body: Tea has senna leaves

title: Works for sleep
body: I recommend Yogi Detox Tea for sleep. Make yourself a cup in late afternoon or early evening and in 3 or 4 hours, you will be sleeping like a baby. Wonderful solution to sleep issues.

title: The Tea does what it says ...im sold This is It
body: I read all the Reviews and was very skeptical ive used the tea years before and just stopped for no reason , well I resumed taking the Tea about 3-4wks ago and yeah my period is here Naturally ...so happy to see it as im trying to balance my hormones Naturally without Birth control... Nature is AWESOME. .. the Tea works, no PmS, NO cramps as before.... Glad I Bought it will continue to drink until my cycle stabilizes...

title: I do like the taste of this tea so I have been ...
body: Ginkgo is rumored to improve memory but I haven't seen any conclusive studies and personally I haven't really tested myself for any improvements. I have no real opinion on the ingredients and their purported benefits. However, I do like the taste of this tea so I have been buying it for years.

title: Taste Great!
body: I love this tea... it taste great and settles your stomach no matter what you eat!!

title: bad mistake! Then
body: There's a lot of different tastes going on with this Tea. I smelled the Tea Bag up close, bad mistake! Then, I told my Husband to smell it, but not to put it too close to his nose, but, he didn't listen! It has black pepper and long pepper in it, so yeah, it was instant "grab the nose" to make it go away! Haha. But, we love this Tea, I  am a big coffee drinker, and  had a cup of this tea along side of my coffee. Found myself wanting to drink the tea instead of the coffee!  I like it cold tho, my Husband prefers it hot

title: Love it!
body: Love it! Great Price!

title: Tastes good and smells good.
body: I brought a pack of 6, I gave one to some of my nursing classmates, knowing how much stress we are under. We were pleasantly surprised to see how relaxed and rested we felt when we woke up. Don't get me wrong, it doesn't make you sleepy. Nonetheless, once you sleep, you wake up the next day you don't feel tired.

title: Five Stars
body: Love this tea!  Multi pack was cost effective, and I hope you continue to stock this item

title: Loved the taste of this tea
body: Loved the taste of this tea, which is great because I was drinking it religiously the last few weeks of my pregnancy! Though I'm not sure how much a part this tea played or not, I did have a very quick labor. This was my second pregnancy and I woke up around 4 am with contractions 5-7 minutes apart and delivered a healthy baby boy 5 1/2 hours later after only 20 minutes of pushing. I did not drink this tea my first pregnancy and was induced, so it's hard to tell if this tea made a difference. I did however enjoy drinking it and helped me keep my water intake up!

title: Wonderful caffeine free tea
body: Its called Bedtime tea as the ingredients in it are those that relax.  I drink it thru out the day, caffeine free and tastes great.  I am now a monthly subscriber to this Yogi tea

title: Four Stars
body: really helpful with period cramps!

title: Five Stars
body: Very good - just what I expected

title: and this is my favorite. It is the most straightforward ginger tea I ...
body: I have tried many ginger teas, and this is my favorite. It is the most straightforward ginger tea I can find (as opposed to others with citrus or other flavors that overshadow the ginger).

title: Delicious and warming tea!
body: Warm and spicy, this tea is great for a cool winter evening.  Ladies - I've been told this tea also helps to regulate estrogen levels (eg., drink on days 5-9 of cycle to help induce ovulation), but it should NOT be used if you're pregnant.

title: pleasant, mild herbal tea
body: Neither honey, nor lemon are particularly in evidence, but a pleasant, mild herbal tea.

title: Great tea
body: I'm addicted to this tea! It's a little bitter, but tastes great with or without honey.

title: Nice way to sleep sound
body: This is my favorite bedtime tea, pun intended. Love the smell and the flavor, and works great for a good night sleep

title: Pregnancy lifesaver
body: Pregnancy lifesaver! I keep a box in my office, extra bags in my purse and the rest at home. Does wonders to settle an upset stomach.

title: If you like Throat comfort...don't buy this.
body: I love Throat Comfort...so I thought I would branch out a bit and try the honey lemon throat comfort.  Well, I wish I hadn't.  I think the flavor is very different and once I make it through my stash I will purchase the regular throat comfort.

title: Love this stuff
body: Previous pregnancy went very well and I drank a lot of this tea.  Not sure if it really makes a difference, but it certainly didn't hurt.  It isn't flavorful, but I'm not drinking it for that reason.  Others may want to add honey or sugar!

title: Very good price on amazon
body: Very good price on amazon. It tastes good and is a nursing support. You could also use fennel seed and oatmeal to increase your breast milk. Also, drinking liquids is the main key. Drink the tea once a day while baby is less than three months to avoid her having upset stomach.

title: Calm Restful Sleep
body: This is my new go-to night time tea! I loved the lightly sweet taste and the calming affect it gives you after a few sips. I work in retail and my sleep is greatly affected by my shifts, so finding quality sleep is crucial. This tea has given me a healthy way of balancing sleep and relaxation. I have been drinking this tea for a few months now and plan on sticking with it. Thank you Yogi tea!!

title: Excellent Value and Assortment!  A+
body: Great value.  Very satisfied with this selection and quality.  Great brand and huge quantity for the price.  Will be purchasing this again in the future.  Hope it stays available.

title: and almost (but not quite) like root beer
body: This tea really works for me.  I drink it nightly, 2 cups if I'm feeling especially stressed out or anxious about something. It does have an interesting flavor...sort of cinnamon, and almost (but not quite) like root beer.  Lol.  It is, perhaps, an acquired taste.

title: Drink before and during cycle
body: Drink this stuff religiously right before and during that time of the month. I mix it with honey or creamer sometimes. Has a herby grassy type flavor but I dont mind. I haven't really noticed a difference or improvement so far but I think it's been a placebo effect for me when I am cramping...:)

title: This does give me a kick of energy without any caffeine which is nice. The taste takes some getting used to
body: I drink one or two bags every day. I even pack a few bags with me whenever I travel! This does give me a kick of energy without any caffeine which is nice. The taste takes some getting used to, but I like it now. I also think that it has evened me out hormonally. I gave some to a friend and she said the same thing. Plus, I love the Yogi quotes on every tea bag. It's like my daily fortune cookie!

title: Awesome!!!!!
body: This tea is awesome! I drink this herbal tea to help regulate my cycle and alleviate cramps, and it does just that! It also has a wonderful taste, no need to add sugar or cream. I will be drinking this tea for a lifetime!

title: Nice, flavorful tea
body: I tried the Green Chai, Black Chai and Roobios Chai teas from Yogi. Of the 3, I prefer the Green Chai. There is nothing wrong with the Rooibos Chai - it is very flavorful, no caffeine, and all organic ingredients. It just my preference (also it has taken me some time to get used to rooibos) I just prefer tea. For those that want to enjoy a good cup of chai tea but are watching their caffeine intake this is a great option.

title: I definitely notice a difference!
body: I have bad arthritis in my knees and have had knee pain for the past year.  I started drinking this tea, along with taking Glucosamine and Turmeric and have noticed a major difference!  If I skip a couple of days by not drinking the tea, I notice that my knees begin to ache again.  For me, this tea really seems to help.  I went in not expecting much, but was very surprised at how good my knees feel.  I really like the taste too.

title: not much vanilla, but good flavor
body: I love vanilla and I love hazelnut, but both seem to be lacking in this tea. The tea, however, does have a good full-bodied flavor. I think of this more as a spiced tea with cinnamon, ginger, and cloves prevailing. The tea brews up with plenty of flavor and has enough spice to make me want to drink it earlier in the day than as a nighttime relaxer. I think the name "Vanilla Hazelnut" is misleading, however.

title: Excellent bedtime tea
body: Excellent tea, I use it before I go to bed, and it is calming but not as strong as the stress relief from yogi. That one is numbing, this one is more of a classic soft warm tea. I love yogi teas, I use several of their flavors, and this one ranks among their best

title: Great Tasting Tea!
body: Bought this tea for the elderberry included not expecting the best taste.  Found that the taste is excellent!  I have changed my choice of evening drink from decaf coffee to this great tasting tea.  Even my wife has started drinking this instead of her morning coffee.

title: Great, Spicy Ginger Tea
body: I love all things ginger, so my opinion may be a bit biased. Fresh ginger is a favorite of mine because of the spicy, astringent bite it has. This tea reminds me of that, although the spicy bite is probably due to the black pepper added. I've tried other ginger teas, lemon ginger teas, green ginger teas - they all seem to have a dry/dull ginger flavor, and I always come back to this one. I love this tea with a dash of honey. It's sweet and spicy and gingery goodness.

title: We love this tea and drink it even when our throats ...
body: We love this tea and drink it even when our throats aren't sore or scratchy.  It needs no sweetener at all, and is lovely every time.

title: Helps Milk Supply
body: Definitely saw a slight uptick in milk production when using this at the beginning.  It does make a difference to follow the directions of 1 upon waking and 2 more during the day.  It's not the most flavorful tea, but it isn't bad either if you're into herbal teas.

title: Purchased this for my girlfriend. She said it helps ...
body: Purchased this for my girlfriend. She said it helps with premenstrual cramps but you have to drink it everyday. As long as it works!

title: Soothing and delicious
body: I can drink this tea everyday! Some gave this to me when I was sick, but I find myself drinking this daily, especially at work where I have to talk to customers a lot and my throat tends to get dry and scratchy by mid day

title: I enjoy taking my tea in the evening times
body: I enjoy taking my tea in the evening times. I use it as a relaxing ritual with a two week break every three months, and its cheaper than the store

title: What a Find!
body: This is my very favorite tea; it also happens to help promote good digestion and for me, reduces symptoms of heartburn.

title: One of my favorites!
body: I've ordered this tea several times now and it's very mild & pleasant - it has helped me cut down on my coffee consumption. It's also great if you've had a rich and/or spicy meal. However, the price seems to be changing rather arbitrarily, and personally I won't buy this for more than the usual slightly below $20 price tag.

title: Afternoon tea
body: I can't drink caffeine after 2 pm, so I drink this Vanilla Hazelnut. Good tasting and has enough flavor to hold up to adding milk to it. Very reputable brand and consistent flavor. Also individually packaged tea bags, so I can carry one in my purse for eating out -- just ask for hot water.

title: Not the best.
body: I bought this product because it was way cheaper than the Traditional Medicines, mothers milk tea. Big disappointment!  I steep 6 bags in a quart jar to drink iced. I prefer the TM brand over this one. I would drink 1 cup of the TM brand and have instant results. If I drank a quart of it, I would would be a raging river!  Not so with Yogi, unfortunately.

title: Initial reaction...
body: Ok so i just got the tea today so i am merely reviewing it on my first reaction to it and i will update again after drinking it for a while. maybe after one or 2 boxes are finished up.

title: Can't hurt to try...
body: I began taking this tea at 36 weeks. I was drinking three cups a day. To me the taste was rather bland, but honestly I was not drinking it for the taste, I was drinking it with the hopes that it would strengthen and tone my uterus. I did not have any abnormal side effects or cramping from this tea. I used an epidural during delivery and even though from what I heard about epidurals making for a longer "pushing" stage of labor, mine was actually unbelievably quick! My doctor had me push three times per contraction. Baby crowned within the first contraction, and was born on the third. I pushed for less than ten minutes! Could it have been the tea? I like to think so. This was my first baby, and even doctor and nurses commented on how well it went! I told them it must have been the tea. haha, Since this was first pregnancy I really have nothing to compare it to, but when breastfeeding I do not feel any cramping and had very limited cramping postpartum. A couple of times the day of & day after delivery. I have continued to drink one cup a day since baby's birth. Figure it can't hurt in helping uterus tone up & get back to size over next few weeks or so...

title: Yucky but WORKS!!!!
body: I purchased this from a health food store and gagged at my first taste.  But IT WORKED WELL WITH MY BRONCHITIS!!! I was thrilled.  So I looked it up on Amazon and it was a much better price.  I want to add that I used this with medicines, etc, but I could barely get a deep breath without an inhaler.  But when I would drink this particular tea, it seemed to open my airways and I was able to get deep breaths without coughing.

title: Sleep for day and night shift transitions
body: I switch back and forth between night shifts and day shifts, frequently.  This Yogi Bedtime Tea plus melatonin really helps me make these otherwise difficult transitions much easier and me, more functional day and night as I have less difficulty getting the sleep that I need.

title: I absolutely love this tea!!!
body: I absolutely love this tea!  It is my all time favorite!!!

title: Good product
body: Use this product almost daily. Tastes good and really works.I've been using this at least once a week for awhile.  My sister had a fatty liver so I gave her a 2 months supply. She uses one bag for two cups of tea a day. Her recent doctors visit confirmed her road to recovery from fatty liver.Adding a better diet also sped up and improved her recovery.Amen! Keep up the good work!

title: Some seriously good stuff!
body: I have never been a believer in any herbal teas until a coworker gave me a mug of BREATHE DEEP tea with honey last winter when I was coughing a lot.  Even one sip brought relief to my throat and by the time I had finished the mug, the coughing was over and done with.  I immediately went on a search for the product and finally found it in the gourmet section of a local grocery.  Then, I found it on Amazon... and a LOT less expensive!  BREATHE DEEP tea has not only helped me with my respiratory issues (asthma, bronchitis, chronic sinus congestion, etc.), I've shared it with family members and friends who are also amazed at what one cup of BREATHE DEEP tea can do.  I'm getting ready to order my supply for the upcoming winter.  I do NOT want to be caught without this in the cupboard.

title: I've been drinking this for years and have recommended it over and over to those with depression
body: I've been drinking this for years and have recommended it over and over to those with depression. If I stop taking it for over a week, I crash and it's not good.  They don't call it 'The Sunshine Herb' for nothing!

title: My favorite lemon ginger tea
body: My favorite tea by far. Has a hint of licorice to give the lemon ginger flavor a hint of sweetness without actually being sweet. And I don't typically like licorice! Glad to find it on here in a pack of 6 as this can be hard to find in stores.

title: Cheaper than Mother's Milk & works great!
body: I purchased this to help boost my supply after a nasty cold & the medicine knocked it down. I am not a fan of it hot, but have made an iced blend for myself & drink 16oz per day on average. It's boosting my supply back up and actually doesn't taste too shabby!

title: Yogi Bedtime Tea Bags
body: This is the first bedtime tea I've tried.  I'm not much of a tea conossuier of any kind for that matter.  My wife bought a box from our local "whole foods" grocery for about $5.50 and I liked it.  I bought six boxes (including shipping) for $14.71 with Amazon's auto-refill option.

title: Refreshing minty flavor
body: I guess I'm not big on hot teas as I've always loved sweet iced tea, but I couldn't taste much from this tea aside from the minty fresh feeling. I was only able to drink a few cups, but I have yet to try it with honey and/or lemon (used only honey once, but still wasn't satisfied). I already had my baby a couple months ago, but I still have all 6 boxes left! Haha, maybe if I can get it tasting good for me, I'll atleast finish up the first box. =]  I did find out a friend of mine LOVES it, though, and she also has a healthy baby now. :]

title: My new favorite
body: When I gave up coffee (and the heartburn it gave me) a friend gave me a box of this tea to try.  I wasn't sure how it would be because its name thru me off.  But after my first sip I knew this would me my new favorite hot drink!  To me it is a warm fruity/spicy flavor that is perfect for my morning, afternoon, or evening drink. No dry aftertaste either! I love it.

title: A great green chai
body: I really like this tea. I have been trying to drink more green tea lately,but I don't care for the taste of plain green tea. This particular brand of green chai has a nice spiciness to it. I sometimes use two bags and add almond milk. I have tried other brands of green chai;this one is my favorite. The little tea fortunes are pretty entertaining as well.

title: Imagine That!
body: When my sister-in-law recommended this tea for my mom's arthritis I thought, "Oh, yeah, I'm sure that's going to help!"  Well, mom said it did help and so I decided to try it too.  I'm a skeptic but it DID work.  On those days when I almost can't stand up due to hip and back pain if I can make it to the kitchen to brew a cup of this tea I feel much better after drinking it.  It doesn't taste really great but I put some Splenda in it and it goes down easy.  It works well enough that I have started brewing about a quart at a time and holding it in the fridg 'till I need it.  Then all I have to do is heat it in the microwave.

title: Not licorice flavor, but sweet
body: Big fan of this tea, and after buying from grocery stores for $5 a box for a year, how happy was I to find the product on Amazon with such a great price! I should have looked on Amazon a year ago!

title: Another fantastic taste from Yogi Tea
body: The taste is great and a cup will kerb your appetite or at least keep the hunger at bay. I have given away quite a few teabags and had good feedback on the taste. The only downside is that it is not sold in the UK or at a very extortionate price. Come on Yogi, please make it more widely available in the UK.  I would definitely recommend this product.

title: tastes yucky but does the job
body: Ex-spouse lived on this stuff while he was getting off the prilosec/nexium spiral. He would get these unbelievably strong stabbing pains and the tea worked. Personally not sure how he could drink so much of it as I found the taste terrible (hence the 3 stars). Not even with honey or any other sweetener could I 'stomach' the taste enough to manage one cup.

title: but I'm very pleased. (Add milk
body: After drinking 3 cups in a 15 hour period, I went from pumping between 3-4 ounces every 4 hours (both boobs) to 5.5-6 ounces!!! I'm also eating a lactation cookie with each cup, so I don't know if the combination is helping as well, but I'm very pleased. (Add milk, makes for a tasty almost-chai tea taste!!).

title: Didn't help with severe menstrual cramps
body: I took it for a few months and I didn't notice any difference. I drank 2-3 cups a day for at least a week before my periods but it still didn't help. I had severe menstrual cramps though. By severe I mean the kind that make you throw up before pain killers start working, feel like you're going to pass out, and writhe in such pain that you are unable to do even the simplest things. This tea probably won't help if you have it that bad.

title: This particular tea has the best formula compare to other ginger tea
body: This particular tea has the best formula compare to other ginger tea, soothing to the stomach and flavorful, but not potent. The added bonus, this is the only tea bag that can make three cups of tea without weakened taste. Love it!

title: Too intense?  Just reduce the dose.
body: For those who find the tea working too intensely, causing diarrhea and severe cramping... just try a milder dose.  I find my best zone for effectiveness and comfort is 1 minute steeping a tea bag, every other day.

title: Five Stars
body: Great flavor, love that is is decaf. Great part of my night time routine.

title: Didn't work for me.
body: Tastes bad to me, like licorice. Honey didn't help much. And I don't think it helped my milk supply increase. I took this tea 3 times a day for 3 days.

title: great flavor and fragrance!!
body: Delicious tasting tea!!  Very aromatic and I feel like it helps me focus when at work!

title: My favorite Chai rooibos.
body: My favorite tea! I used to buy Trader Joe's Ruby Red Chai, but they discontinued it. I found this at Sprout's Farmer's Market, but buying by the case at Amazon is a better value, and means I won't run out!

title: ... this tea when I feel "foggy headed" I feel better (clear) within 24 hours
body: I drink this tea when I feel "foggy headed" I feel better (clear) within 24 hours.

title: Cramps Eased
body: I bought this tea after Google'ing remedies for easing menstrual cramps.  I have had painful periods since I was 11 years old and I am now 24.  I began drinking this tea 2 days before my period was expected, drinking about 3 cups/day.  The taste is different, but you get used to it.

title: Love the flavor of this tea
body: Love the flavor of this tea; very happy with the ingredients. Makes consuming more liquid much easier than just drinking straight water.

title: The best tea for "that time of the month
body: The best tea for "that time of the month," when nothing else will help. Helps with bloating and discomfort.

title: Favorite licorice tea
body: Favorite licorice tea, hands down.  I know eating/drinking too much licorice can increase your blood pressure, but whatever, it's worth the risk.  Anyway, my blood pressure is normal, and I've been drinking this tea for at least 5 years.

title: This is a wonderful, balancing tea
body: This is a wonderful, balancing tea.  Tastes good and makes me feel calm but alert.  Recommend a couple times a week, particularly on stressful days.

title: Five Stars
body: It quells the raging monster deep within.

title: Great tea
body: This tea tastes great just as it is with no additional additives. This is my nightly brew before bed time and has replaced my previous brew (Yogi Detox) due to the great taste (though Detox isn't bad, this is just better).

title: Fantastic Brand!
body: I love this tea! I love the quality ingredients Yogi uses. I'm so glad they have subscription options that fit my needs.

title: I love this tea to take in my purse for a ...
body: The shipment came fast and was what it said it would be. I love this tea to take in my purse for a desert when out to eat.

title: Yum
body: Perfect bedtime tea!

title: Relaxing and Tastes Great
body: Excellent tea. Very relaxing. Great flavor also. Tastes sweet, a little like licorice. We drink this almost every night before bed.

title: Very refreshing!
body: Even though the title says Joint Comfort, I love this tea for it's refreshing minty green tea taste!  I drink regularly just because it tastes so good!

title: It's soothing and is a nice way to end the evening
body: My hubby and I drink this every night before bed.  It's soothing and is a nice way to end the evening.

title: Five Stars
body: Will continue to buy

title: ... tea as far as flavor (which is why I like it) and it seems to help supply a little
body: This is a mild tea as far as flavor (which is why I like it) and it seems to help supply a little.

title: Probably gave me an awesome first labor
body: When I was six months pregnant I was telling my midwife how I had been having frequent Braxton Hicks contractions since 4 months and that they were annoying me.  She suggested red raspberry leaf tea to ease them.  It did not ease my contractions though I drank a cup a day for the rest of my pregnancy, but on the day I gave birth, I woke up at 8am in early labor, which lasted maybe til 2:30pm.  By 4:30, I decided it was time to go to the birth center, I was 8cm by the time I got there at 5:00, and my son was born by 7:35.  VERY fast for a first labor.  No pain medication or interventions necessary.

title: LOVE THIS TEA!
body: I've been drinking this tea for years and I was very excited to find such a cost effective option to order in bulk like this. It works great! I drink it before bed, its caffeine free and there's something about the licorice undertones that is calming. An hour or two after I wake up, BAM! I swear the detoxing effect helps my skin too!  This tea will get you moving. Enough said.

title: Excellent Quality Ingredients
body: The ingredients are fresh and wholesome.  However, the taste is in my opinion, bland.  It is effective but you must be consistent in its use.  Use it daily and be patient.  After several weeks,  you will notice that you are feeling much better.  I have to brew it with another flavor of the Yogi tea because I do not like the taste.  It does not taste nasty, just very bland.  The results are worth it.

title: Five Stars
body: I love this tea.  The cost is very reasonable when purchased in bulk.

title: Love it
body: I love the flavor and it has the side-benefit of being a calming tea.

title: Best organic teac
body: This is clearly my favorite organic tea. I Buy it in bulk because I drink so much of it. If you want to improve the quality of the taste just use a slightly large mug and use 2 tea bags at a time. It takes great.

title: Delicious and unique chai blend at a great price.
body: This spicy, flavorful tea is deliciously cozy. A wonderful blend for chai lovers, and for those who favor cinnamon or other autumn spices.

title: Smooth move
body: It's a must have at my house.  My husband drinks 2 cups every night.

title: My favorite, but can be hard to find locally
body: This makes delicious hot tea in winter and iced in the warm months...I used to buy the Aveda licorice mint tea, but was so happy to discover this much more affordable option. Amazon has a great price with subscribe and save. I have a hard time finding it in our local stores so I'm very happy to buy from Amazon.

title: Omg...
body: It is awesome! Love this tea!! So calming, organic and made with pure intentions. Love the bulk buy option. Will continue to buy. Five Stars!

title: Doesn't Taste Fresh When Buying Online
body: For some reason, this tea doesn't taste as strong and fresh as it does when I buy it in a grocery store. But, I guess it does the job. I'd rather pay more and purchase from the store when I can find it.

title: Great, Spicy Ginger Tea
body: I love all things ginger, so my opinion may be a bit biased. Fresh ginger is a favorite of mine because of the spicy, astringent bite it has. This tea reminds me of that, although the spicy bite is probably due to the black pepper added. I've tried other ginger teas, lemon ginger teas, green ginger teas - they all seem to have a dry/dull ginger flavor, and I always come back to this one. I love this tea with a dash of honey. It's sweet and spicy and gingery goodness.

title: If you don't like licorice, this tea will not be a flavor ...
body: Eneryone at our office swears by this tea.  Be prepared for high notes of anise.  If you don't like licorice, this tea will not be a flavor favorite for you, but it is an excellent tea for the sniffles of allergy season.

title: LOVE!
body: Love this tea both hot & iced. Delish, and great for digestion too!

title: Good value for mulit packs
body: Tea is gentle on your stomach and has the right combination of ingredients to be good for stomach issues.  Yogi makes a good quality tea.  It is a good value in the multi packs sold here.

title: Very tasty.  Handy for work.
body: Very tasty.  Handy for work.  I sweeten it with liquid stevia and it provides a break in the day.

title: best flavor!
body: This is my favorite tea! Very flavorful great with hazelnut creamer. Full bodied, excellent coffee alternative but caffeine free. Several of my for hard coffee drinking friends have switched to this tea after trying it once.

title: Five Stars
body: My daughter and I both enjoy the flavor and the relaxing effect of this tea. Great before bed.

title: I steep it for a good ten minutes
body: It works well. Might need to adjust steep time if need to. If I really need it, I steep it for a good ten minutes. It does the trick. I have ordered this many times for family. It has worked for everyone that has used it in my family.

title: NIce Ginger Tea
body: My husband always prefers to make fresh ginger tea by boiling fresh ginger in water. Yogi Ginger Tea is the next best thing to that and I like to pack a few with us while we travel and take it with me to work.

title: Great Tea
body: My midwife suggested drinking this (4-5 time daily) for the last few weeks of my pregnancy.  This is the only Yogi Raspberry Leaf Tea I could find in bulk on Amazon.  It came on time.  It has somewhat of a bitter taste, so I add a touch of honey.

title: Yummy treat to warm the soul!
body: I absolutely LOVE this tea. In fact I ordered two cases after my mother tried it and told me she must have some because she can't begin to think about going through a cold hard winter without it! It arrived safely and before I expected to arrive. I often will hand a bag to coworkers who are having a tough day or to show my appreciation and everyone raves about how delicious it is. You must steep this for at least 5 minutes.

title: Great tasting tea
body: This particular flavor is hard to gin in stores so good deal to get in quantity here. I am a "tea-aholic" so drink a few different kinds at night such as this and chamomile so can't be certain how much the St. John wort works but I do feel relaxed with my combos. Very good tasting too

title: Stomach Ease Tea
body: As a person with chronic stomach problems, this tea is soothing and tastes really good.  I am not recommending it to cure anything, it seems to help digestion when I have a cup immediately after a meal.  And, when I want a large mug of tea, I sometimes use one of these teabags along with one Yogi Super Antioxidant Green Tea bag.

title: delicious
body: I bought raspberry leaf tea on my doctors recommendation - using it to reduce inflammation. This tea tastes great and helps with the inflammation too. I have tried 2 other brands but the taste was bland. I am please with this purchase

title: I ordered a 6 pack as it is my new favorite. The box arrived much faster than expected
body: This was a surprise and first received as a gift from a friend when I was sick. I usually drink Stash black chai tea and this is similar, it is the licorice root that is unique - and while I don't care much for it as a rule, it is delightful! I ordered a 6 pack as it is my new favorite. The box arrived much faster than expected. Very happy with the product and seller.

title: Try this!!! Fully recommend!
body: My husband doesn't like most of the Yogi brand teas I've bought him. He loves this one. I will say that the taste is superb.  Because I have a sweet tooth, I do put some beet sugar rocks in the tea to sweeten it up a tad. Wonderful flavors. Has done wonders for my body so far. LOVE! A must try if you haven't!

title: very comforting !
body: I usually get a dry cough after a long flight. Sometimes I can't talk for days after my travel so this time I tried this tea and it really helped me recover faster. It also tastes good as it has a slight sweetness to it. So I highly recommend it !  My dad tried it too and he liked it :)

title: Incredible tasting tea that is naturally sweet
body: This tea both tastes delicious and smells amazing. The blend of spices has a rich, complex flavor that never gets bitter even after leaving the tea bag in my mug the entire time I'm drinking the tea. I don't even like licorice but this tea doesn't taste like licorice candy; it's much more nuanced and balanced with other spices. The best part is that it has a hint of sweetness so no additional sugar or sweetener is needed.

title: Very helpful for me
body: I tried this and the Traditional Medicinals and this was a lot more helpful to me.  The flavor and smell of this tea seemed more intense and concentrated compared to TM.  I have very, very low production and this tea helped me increase my production from 4 oz to 6-7 oz daily.  I drink 3-4 times a day.

title: Don't you just love the different messages on the bags
body: Don't you just love the different messages on the bags. I compared and this had the best bulk price. This is really helping tone my uterine muscles. I waited until I moved to the new place because I hear it's very effective, I started with one every other day, then one a day, and by 35 weeks I'll do three a day. Either I started getting contractions at 32 coincidentally or it really does work. Don't worry it's not going to bring baby before term, it's just getting you strong to spend half the time your body was going labor.

title: best flavor!
body: This is my favorite tea! Very flavorful great with hazelnut creamer. Full bodied, excellent coffee alternative but caffeine free. Several of my for hard coffee drinking friends have switched to this tea after trying it once.

title: Tasty, but did not deliver "calmness" and "a good night's sleep" as stated
body: I bought this product to "calm the body and mind and encourage a good night's sleep" and because it "Promotes a state of relaxed awareness." It was tasty, but otherwise did not deliver. Even using two tea bags, it was pretty much just a tasty cup of tea.

title: More visits to the restroom but nothing serious
body: I believe the tea has ginger which I love. It is one of those tastes and smells that wakes you up! That's why I like drinking it in the morning before breakfast if I'm not too hungry otherwise food comes first! Regarding the comments about its effect on acne. I didn't experience any breakouts from the tea but I did visit the bathroom a bit more easily but nothing that made me run like my life depended on it.

title: I fell in love with Rooibos tea when I lived in South Africa ...
body: I've been addicted to this tea for several years. Also got my mom hooked on Rooibos Chai- I bulk order and ship it to her in London. I fell in love with Rooibos tea when I lived in South Africa and after my big stash ran out when I came back to the US, I scoured the internet trying to find rooibos tea. Rooibos chai is a perfect combination of two types of tea that i love. I drink my tea with french vanilla coffee creamer which takes it up a notch.

title: Wonderful Tea! Helps Regulate Female Hormones! Makes Cycling a Breeze!
body: Helps regulate female hormones. I drink a few cups of this tea for about 1-2 weeks daily every month. I love it! Helps relieve PMS symptoms and discomfort during that "time". Highly recommend! A natural aid in female health! Tastes delicious with a spoonful of honey! I can't imagine a month without it now!

title: This is great lemon ginger tea
body: This is great lemon ginger tea. This is more on the ginger side, so if you prefer a hint of ginger, do not get this. I would recommend the Celestial tea for a hint of ginger. This tea is more of a 60-40 (lemon to ginger) ratio. I love drinking it hot, it makes my tummy feel nice and cozy.

title: So good for stress!
body: I'll add my voice to all the others-tastes good and effectively diffuses stress at any time of the month.  Any time I'm just really cranky or stressed out, one cup is enough to have me feeling a lot more zen about the world.  Good stuff.

title: Mmmmmm
body: This tea is very tasty.  I love the cinnamon and ginger flavors.  It's great for an upset stomach too.  It's mildly sweet, so I do not put any sweetener in it.  I drink it plain and enjoy its rich aroma and relax after a long day.

title: The Best Herbal Teas I have EVER tasted & so HEALTHY!!!!
body: Best herbal teas I have ever had or will ever have again!! After experiencing the flavor, I almost forgot about ALL the beneficial herbs in this tea and how good it is for what ails you! I highly recommend this tea line, as Yogi Teas are just superior to others!! I've tried at least 8-9 flavors and NOT one has disappointed!!! Do yourself a favor & if feeling sick, order the cold sampler pack....so good & it helps!!!!

title: Delicious (and I really don’t like tea! ) This tea changed my mind
body: Delicious (and I really don’t like tea!)

title: Great Tea
body: I have been drinking Yogi tea since my first trimester. Now that I'm in my 3rd and ready to deliver I have upped my consumption to 2-3 cups a day with two tea bag in each cup, I actually bought a case from Amazon. I am birthing at a natural birthing center and all the doulas and midwives encourage the drinking of raspberry leaf, which is in the Woman's Mother To Be Tea. Its a very calming tea and I enjoy it with a squeeze of lemon and agave nectar.

title: Relaxing, Delicious, & Worth trying!
body: Perfect transaction & great tasting tea with a soothing relaxing effect. Price could be better but its still worth it. Might be worth looking into buying pure kava root if you want a better value but this tea has other ingredients that make it taste better so pure kava root may not be a better choice for everyone. Worth a try!

title: Anti-stress is right!
body: I had heard about this tea from some friends and then read some reviews online.  I was excited for my wife to try it (she is a little high strung. . .).  Unfortunately, she has celiac disease and this tea is not gluten free (contains barley).  I, however, loved it.  It really lives up to the hype (or anti-hype as it were).  I had a cup with 2 bags and I couldn't remember the rest of the night.

title: YEAH!
body: So excited to be able to have this product on hand WHEN IT'S needed. So many times we have needed this product and unable to find it in the small town we live in. It is a great comforting product to have on hand.

title: Okay, but not at good as the Traditional Medicinals Organic Throat Coat
body: It might just be personal preference but the Traditional Medicinal's Throat Coat seems to taste better and to provide more relief from the dry scratchy throat. This one is okay but it's missing something.

title: Great price
body: Amazon offers the best price out there for this product. I haven't experienced any cramping that people have mentioned. I started drinking this tea twice a day when I was 34 weeks pregnant. Right now I'm at 38 weeks and really don't know if it works. I guess I can update my review about the efficiency of this product after I deliver!

title: Flavor is fine :)
body: Just an FYI, because I had no idea, this just tastes like typical, unsweetened iced tea (I ice mine rather than drink it hot).  I'm pregnant and I was worried about how this would taste because I can't handle gross things right now, but it just taste like plain old tea to me :)

title: Works Great!
body: I tend to get upset stomach/nausea in the evennings. This NEVER fails to make me feel better. I love it. They don't sell it at stores in my area anymore, so I was fine with buying a case of it!

title: Great variety in each pack
body: Great variety in each pack and you do save some money buying the bigger pack. Some types taste better than others but they are all full of good-for-you herbs so we drink them all. And we haven't gotten sick, but that could also be due to our good hand hygiene and not having kids in the house! We always drink this and EmergenC.

title: Very naturally sweet. I bought this so that I could quit ...
body: Very naturally sweet. I bought this so that I could quit soda and eat less junk food during the day, and for that, this has worked great. The flavor is very strong, and will flavor a travel-mug sized cup. It's not subtle or anything, but it's great for people who want a strong, sweet flavor.

title: My favorite tea and I'm not a tea drinker
body: I've always disliked tea unless it had lots of sugar added.  Until I found this one!  The first day I added stevia to it and it was okay.  The second day I tried it without stevia and it was okay.  By the third day I was hooked!  I love the combination of the spices.  I like this one hot and cold and drink at least one cup a day now.  I've tried other detox teas and they remind me of tea - yucky!  The combination of spices is just right in this detox tea.  Evidently it has a strong smell because people walking towards my office can tell when I'm drinking the detox tea.  I don't notice the aroma but others do.  Try the tea and you'll love it!

title: Best tea I tried.
body: Here at the office we started a "tea catering club", and we are actually hooked with Yogi teas. We have tasted over 15 different types but I have to say I like this the most. It has a mild flavor (find it a little bit sweet too) and I definitely feel my mood changing after drinking it, I have seen it in others too (Someone asked me right away what this is and after drinking it became a fan too!), so for me, it's not placebo.

title: Good stuff
body: Tea tastes great.  I drink a cup or two a day.  Not sure how big of an effect it has had (yet), but I have noticed an effect when using other ginkgo teas in the past, so I believe in it.

title: Easy to brew but lacking depth.
body: This is a very good product but you really have to use at least two bags to get the same robust flavor as home brewed Chai tea. It seems to lack depth, but it certainly is convenient!

title: Great for IBS and Constipation, NOT HARSH
body: Keeps you regular, soothes the tummy, basically awesome if you have constipation prone IBS and bloating. LOVE. It's also not harsh like many other laxative teas out there. Tasty too!

title: Cured me coming off depo shot
body: Been drinking the tea for 2 months after having stopped depo shot and wanted my regular cycle back. It's working great, my cycle is already back to normal and only PMS for like 2 days. My Hormonal acne also improved and moon swings did too. I still get some ovulation pain that week but hoping that clears up after a few more months. Try to drink 2 cups a day to see improvement.

title: Might Work For You....
body: Don't know if it really works or not, but I got pregnant pretty quickly. Some people have complained about the taste, but I thought it was pretty good. I just put some honey in it.

title: Best for nausea and headaches!
body: I've had months of morning sickness and and migraine prone. This tea has saved my pregnancy. I drink it ever morning, as ginger keeps both nausea and migraines at bay! Nice spicy-peppery kick to it. Not a mild tea.

title: Good tea
body: I enjoy this tea very much. I drink at least a cup a day. I recommend to everybody that usually gets sick.

title: Three Stars
body: I love yogi tea, but the taste of this tea i did not like

title: Good sleep
body: I purchased this for my mom who was having trouble sleeping after surgery.  She loves it.  She drinks a cup of it before going to bed and it helps her get a few hours of good sleep.  Sometimes she will drink a second cup during the night to get some more rest.  It seems to last for 2-3 hours with drinking one cup.

title: Personal preference if you enjoy it. Ginger is recommended for people suffering from ...
body: Very strong ginger flavor. Personal preference if you enjoy it. Ginger is recommended for people suffering from IBS or GERD, and helps with digestion.

title: YEAH!
body: So excited to be able to have this product on hand WHEN IT'S needed. So many times we have needed this product and unable to find it in the small town we live in. It is a great comforting product to have on hand.

title: Helped with my post partum recovery
body: The birth of my first baby was a traumatic experience, so I was determined to have a better experience the next time around.  I started drinking this tea in my second trimester when I was pregnant with my second baby.  I started out with one cup a day and eventually was drinking 3 to 4 cups a day. I also increased the potency over time by adding more tea bags at each session. I drank it both hot and cold. I pretty much drank it all the time and actually enjoyed the taste. It tastes like a mild black tea.

title: Only the best !
body: Just made a mug full ! Great Yogi tea. Best for settling my stomach, especially after eating too much or too close to bedtime. I order 6 at a time. Never want to be without !

title: Wonderful tea
body: I first tried this tea about a year ago and I have been drinking a cup of it just about every night since then.  I am addicted!  I like spicy flavors so for me, the intense ginger and pepper combination is really appealing.  I suffer with digestive problems and this tea has really helped me sleep through the night without tummy troubles.  Highly recommended for those who want a zippy, spicy tea that is also very soothing.

title: Five Stars
body: Love the Yogi teas!!! Highly recommend!!!!

title: Five Stars
body: Love this tea! It's fantastic. Great price for this tea.

title: This tea is my favorite of the Yogi brand
body: This tea is my favorite of the Yogi brand. I love my ginger hot when I use pure ginger and this is the closest I get to that strong rich ginger flavor that I love. Most teas takes hours to get the richness from the tea bag, but the bag in this tea just keeps brewing and gets stronger even when the water gets cool!

title: Tastes yummy and it works!
body: After my first couple cups of this tea, I literally could not wipe the smile off my face.  I drink one or two cups a day and it keeps me smiling even through menial work and boring customers (I work as a bartender in a very un-busy bar).  While I know I'm not experiencing true joy, at least I don't feel depressed while at work.

title: great Ginkgo tea
body: I've tried a variety of Ginkgo teas and this one is so far the best! No green tea added. Tastes smooth and somewhat sweet. Price is great too.  I highly recommend it!

title: Overall pretty good.  Use two bags at least.
body: Decent taste,  I like it,  but I can see if others do not.  Like others,  you'll need to use two tea bags to feel a little relaxed.  If you may feel your mouth slightly numb,  don't worry that's just the way Kava works.  I recommend using warm milk instead of water,  or add a little bit of milk to your water before you heat it up for better results.  Enjoy!

title: Wow
body: This has one incredible scent. Talk about aroma therapy. I usually mix my teas with others but with this one I do not need to. This is especially tasty with cream.

title: good flavor, works for me!
body: I have been taking this Kava Stress Relief tea for a few months now and it seems to greatly reduce episodes of headaches/migraines and it tastes good. Now I may only have 1 headache every 2-3 weeks or less and not as severe when before I was having them every day...

title: No caffiene!  Love my morning jolt--on auto ship!  Txs Amazon!
body: When I was advised to not take in any caffeine at all, I thought I'd die.  But in order to get rid of migraines, I would have tried anything.  I'm glad I did!  With the help of this tea as a part of my morning routine, I am doing GREAT!  I take the hot tea and pour it over a glass of ice.... YUM! What a nice pick me up!

title: This tea really works for me!
body: I brew a small pot of tea every night and this tea has improved my sleep duration tremendously. I had trouble falling asleep, and this tea has really helped me.

title: This is an OK substitute for the original formula of Good Earth Sweet & Spicy
body: Tasty licorice tea. This is an OK substitute for the original formula of Good Earth Sweet & Spicy, but not a dead ringer. I find it's very relaxing to drink before bedtime, and has an mild calming effect. Not a zippy, perk-me-up tea, in my experience. Really nice licorice flavor, though, and the price per unit was good when I purchased in bulk.

title: I brewed some up and was fine. On a side note
body: No colds this season even though my co-workers and students on the other side of my desk did. At the first sign of an itchy throat, I brewed some up and was fine. On a side note, my son can't use the tea as while it does get rid of cold symptoms, it gives him a headache; maybe an allergy?

title: Weaning off of coffee/caffeinated beverages?
body: With a little coconut milk and agave, I'm hardly missing the morning coffee.  Even better: it helps reduce intestinal irritation and improves digestion.  Happy gut!

title: Soothing, Effective, and Tastes Great!
