title: It really works for sleep
body: I am not a tea user, but I decide to give this a try. I suffer from a very bad insomnia and after dealing with  the side effects of my prescription medication (Ambien), I wanted a natural way to deal with my problem. I tried several remedies like valerian root pills, but nothing work. This tea really surprise me! Never thought it could work this good. I fall asleep fast and I wake up refreshed. Plus it taste good. I really enjoy it with honey, vanilla extract and Truvia. Usually I hate the taste of tea no matter what I add on it. This is Tea is the exception.  Im thinking on trying other tea varieties of this brand.

title: Favorite Licorice Tea Anywhere, great Price
body: Best tea brand in the US (courtesy of Yogi Bhajan, Master of Kundalini Yoga).

title: Helped when I was hungry
body: It didn't make me feel full or anything, but it did help take the edge off.  I found it to have a black licorice taste, and I'm not particularly fond of licorice, but I drank it anyway.  Note:  It's not recommended for nursing mothers.

title: Too much spice for me
body: I have tried this tea many different ways, but I still haven't fallen in love with it. The flavor is weird for me, but it isn't bad. It's spicier than I was expecting, and I haven't noticed it helping me fall asleep or relax. I plan to keep drinking it, but I doubt I'll purchase again.

title: LOVE THIS TEA
body: This tea is my favorite. It is strong and spicy, not the weak, acidic flavor that characterize a lot of herbal teas. After my morning dose of black tea I usually switch to the India Spice for the afternoon and evening. I highly recommend this Yogi tea. Enjoy.

title: Love this tea
body: I love Yogi tea and this is one of the best. I use it every morning to wake up and get clarity.

title: Five Stars
body: This tea is a great bedtime tea and I love the ginger and lemon taste. I use this tea especially when I've got phlegm in my throat or chest because the warm peppery ginger really soothes and calms it down.  I do add a little honey when I use it for the cough. Otherwise it is a great tea all by itself and I drink it for inflammation as well, as I also have fibromyalgia.

title: Comfort and good taste
body: This is a great price for a great tea. I have been drinking it for over two years and still get some relief from my back stifnes

title: Tasty, super effective tea for upset digestive systems
body: I have a sensitive stomach that can be bothered by foods or stress and this tea is a miracle worker for me. I will drink it as soon as I feel an upset stomach or nausea or diarrhea. It works better than any medicine. Try it! You will not regret it- especially because it tastes great.

title: Best tea for cold cough flu whether old or young!!!
body: This is an amazing tea kept my family healthy apart from some sneezes and sniffles. No major problems all through winter. We were constantly sick last few winters but this winter we sailed through it healthy. Everyone in my family loves the taste old and young alike. I have already recommended this tea to all my friends. Love this tea!

title: Soothing, calming with a hint of sweetness
body: Love this tea.  Sweet and gentle.  I like it extra sweet so I use two teabags per a 12oz cup.  Whenever I'm feeling under the weather, I drink this and feel better.  The price is good if you buy in bulk.

title: Yogi Joint Comfort
body: Since I do struggle with sports related injuries, I find this to be a good prouct to use to help with that.

title: Best tea ever!
body: My absolute favorite tea ever.  It is rich and delicious.  Great as hot tea in winter and fabulous as a cool down iced tea in the summer.  It does not taste like licorice candy either. It has a more luxurious mouth feel and a rich, sweet, all-over mouth taste.  Doesn't even need honey!

title: Good, strong chai tea
body: I tried the Green Chai, Black Chai and Roobios Chai teas from Yogi. Of the 3, I prefer the Green Chai over the Black Chai. The Rooibos Chai is my least favorite of the 3 - but it is still good!  All ingredients are organic, and the smell, and taste of this tea is amazing. It may be too strong for some people (including my family members) but I do enjoy it. I dont add milk or sweetner, I just drink them plain. Great pick me up and very relaxing. The only reason that I prefer the Green Chai over the Black Chai - caffeine content, the green chai has lower caffeine.

title: Wow, strong and flavorful tea!!!
body: I tried the Green Chai, Black Chai and Roobios Chai teas from Yogi. Of the 3, I prefer the Green Chai over the Black Chai. The Rooibos Chai is my least favorite of the 3 - but it is still good!  All ingredients are organic, and the smell, and taste of this tea is amazing. It may be too strong for some people (including my family members) but I do enjoy it. I dont add milk or sweetner, I just drink them plain. Great pick me up and very relaxing. The only reason that I prefer the Green Chai over the Black Chai - caffeine content, the green chai has lower caffeine.

title: Delicious tea
body: I really like this tea - the taste just appeals to me.  I have no idea if it helps with mood, but generally drink a cup a day.  The bags are individually sealed to keep it fresh, buying it on Amazon is easy, and I like the package of 6 boxes.

title: Quality Product with All Organic Ingredients!
body: Yogi is a high quality product and every Yogi tea I have purchased contains all organic ingredients. Ginger is used for digestion and to prevent migraines.  I am using it to prevent headaches but, have become addicted to the flavor!  I highly recommend Yogi tea.

title: ... my hormonal acne but I was afraid of the painful cramps and all the rest that comes when dealing ...
body: I recently came off the pill to try a more natural approach to calm and heal my hormonal acne but I was afraid of the painful cramps and all the rest that comes when dealing hormonal imbalance. A friend recommended this tea and said I should give a try that it had worked wonders for her. I started taking 1-2 a day and now I make a jar every morning at work and instead of drinking wanter I drink this. My first period after getting off the pill was quite horrible and painful, by the second month the PMS, cramps and pain were much less and I just recently saw my period for the 3rd time after the pill and I must say I am so thankful to this tea, cramps lasted a little over 3 hours the first day and after that I had no pain at all, minor discomfort but nothing out of the ordinary. I wasn't as depressed, my emotions weren't all over the place as per usual and it was all together a smoother process. I will definitely continue to purchase this tea. I truly recommend it.

title: Yummy and warming
body: This tea is very tasty and it helped me make the transition away from coffee/caffeine when I was pregnant. Satisfied the coffee cravings. I still drink it now, almost every evening when it is cool outside.

title: Yum! Get ready to void your toxins out!
body: Yogi Tea company seems to be spot on with their teas, and this DeTox is no exception. I've been drinking this tea several times a week, regularly for the last year. I can say that the taste is wonderful - one of my favorites. Adding a tiny amount of Stevia in the Raw makes it perfect for my personal taste.  I am not sure about the internal workings of the detoxification process, but I can say with certainty that this tea will make you urinate much more than usual. Having said that, I would limit drinking close to bedtime. Enjoy!

title: I often take a hot cup of Egyptian Licorice tea ...
body: I often take a hot cup of Egyptian Licorice tea in a thermos to have in my car.  Besides enjoying the flavor, I find it helps me control a chronic cough I've had for years.

title: I buy in bulk now, everybody at work loves ...
body: I buy in bulk now, everybody at work loves it during cold season, so I keep a couple of boxes there.  Also - my daughter sings, this is a real GO TO when anybody in the band has a cold.  Helps them get through a gig.

title: Perfect Chai in the USA
body: Best Chai tea west of Mumbai - spice combination could not be better. Not too strong yet very flavorful - best spice combination in the USA - I think I have tried every brand sold and this is the best.

title: and I'm still able and comfortable, and plan to remain in my home until ...
body: This tea works for me.  I've used it for about 20 years.  Here again as a Senior Citizen, I mean over 65, and I do not have any joint pains.  Plus I live in a three level house, and I'm still able and comfortable, and plan to remain in my home until I'm carried out feet first.

title: I love the taste and it has help me with my ...
body: I been using this product for a long time, I love the taste and it has help me with my awful periods. Is true what others reviewers say that if you want potency you will need two bags but I still use only one bag and it works for me; maybe it depends on individuals and their metabolism. I was surprise to find it in amazon cheaper than in the store.

title: Works well
body: I have a very easily upset stomach. I used Yogi ginger which worked well, but when I saw this type I figured I'd give it a try. And it really does live up to the name "Stomach Ease." Obviously it isn't magic, but it definitely does a good job of making my stomach feel better after a meal and at bedtime.

title: Eases nausea, softens stool
body: Unfortunately I often feel slightly nauseated so I was thrilled to discover this tea. It is delicious without any sweetener and it really soothes my insides. It eases away stomach upset and also, sorry about being graphic, it softens stools a bit also, which is welcome especially as we get older. I enjoy it every night with dinner and like it so much I have added it to my Amazon Subscribe and Save order.

title: Bedtime Tea!
body: This is great tea, if you want to relax or sleep. I drink it every night as part of my routine prior to bed. I do add a small amount of organic maple syrup to it, which really enhances the flavor profile. Do not drink this in the afternoon, it may make you sleepy.

title: My favorite Yogi Tea! Super Sweet and delicious!
body: This is my favorite Yogi tea! It is very, very sweet for those of us with a sweet tooth. This is great for when you are craving a dessert and opt for this instead! I have this tea all of the time and definitely recommend you try it!

title: Throat Coat has 2 herbs that are good for IC that Throat Comfort does not have
body: I got this tea by accident instead of Throat Coat.  Throat Coat has 2 herbs that are good for IC that Throat Comfort does not have.  It tastes good and my grandson likes it.  I think it is nice for the throat, just not what I had intended to order.

title: MOST DELICIOUS TEA ON THE PLANET...
body: Best Tea EVER! (well maybe good quality Chrysanthemum Tea gives it a run for the money). We drink this round the clock! Good price from Amazon. Wish it were microwave safe (didn't really try to use it with microwave because each teabag has metal staples).

title: Comfort Tea.
body: I like it plus I think it`s helping my stiff joints. I try to take as good care of my body as possible. I believe everyone should be aware the body is where you live , you can`t move if it gets old and hurting.

title: It will mildy relax you but its not like immediate shutdown
body: If you are a serious insomniac that has a constant nightly change up, this Bedtime tea is decent. But it wont just put you to sleep. It will mildy relax you but its not like immediate shutdown. Gradually it will make you relaxed. Taste alright mixed with honey.

title: Tastes fine.
body: Tastes better than I expected. For some reason, because it is for detoxing I expected a strong and/or unpleasant taste. Nope tastes as mild as regular tea. I have no idea how well it's working though or how to gauge that.

title: Best tea EVER
body: Seriously. The tastiest tea EVER. Perfect for after dinner when you are craving something sweet but don't want to ruin your diet. Also, it doesn't taste like licorice at all. I know that's weird, but seriously just trust me on this. Oh-so-tasty! Spicy and sweet! Plus, it's ridiculously cheap here on Amazon vs buying it in the grocery stores.

title: Part of my nightly routine
body: This ginger tea is a great ending to my day. Ginger aids in digestion and the combination of ginger root, lemongrass, licorice root, peppermint & black pepper makes it just the right about of "warm spice". I use 1 bag for 16oz of hot water and steep it covered for 7 minutes before I drink it.

title: Delicious Tea
body: If you like peppermint tea, then you'll love this.  As long as you're willing to buy 6 boxes at a time, you can't beat the price either.  We like to drink this in the evenings before bed; there's no caffeine and it tastes great.

title: I love the taste
body: I tried some other Detox Tea but I did not like the taste unlike this one I really loved it

title: Delicious and quells those sugar cravings
body: My favorite licorice tea on the market, especially for the price. Some boxes of licorice tea in stores are priced in the $9 range. This is much less expensive and delivers the same taste as the others. Love this tea after meals when I'm craving something sweet. Licorice is naturally sweeter than sugar so quells all those cravings.

title: I wouldn't go through a winter without it
body: This tea is the BEST for alleviating cold symptoms and soothing a sore throat. I ordered this case for my sister and have previously given boxes of this tea to various friends and coworkers. Everybody raves about it!

title: Highly recommended
body: Tastes great, not like dirt like some reviewers say. I use 2 packets for stronger feel. Definitely doesn't give you a buzz like pure kava will give you but it makes me very relaxed. Highly recommended

title: My favorite tea
body: I absolutely love this tea.  It is spicy and delicious.  I recently served it to guests and they couldn't get over how flavorful it is.  Add a little honey and you're all set.  This is my favorite of all the Yogi teas.

title: This tea tastes great!
body: I decided to try this tea after hearing the Consumer Report that it is effective for depression. While not depressed, I do have a lot of anxiety so I thought I would try a tea with St. John's Wort. I was unable to find this tea in my grocery store and I thought this was a really great price for a six pack of tea.

title: For the tea addict who can't have caffeine before bed.
body: This is one of my favorite teas. I love it so much that I commit to getting it delivered to my house every month. It's so relaxing to have a cup before bed. I am sensitive to caffeine, so it's a must. I'll let you read the box for the ingredients, but I think the cinnamon really makes this tea; it gives you a subtle sense that the tea is sweetened without actually putting in sweetener.

title: Became my new favorite
body: This tea is truly amazing! I was drinking the regular Yogi Ginger tea on occasion, then saw this one in store and fell in love. The other one was good, but this one is AWESOME! I love the natural sweetness this one has, it makes it very good! If you are looking at a ginger tea, I would recommend trying this and the other ginger tea and see which you like more. In short, the regular Yogi Ginger tea is more spicy, and this one is more sweet.

title: Aveda Comfort tea at discount price!
body: This is one of my favorite teas! It is good hot or cold and can really get your day started right! This is a great replacement for the Aveda 'Comforting' tea which will cost you around $20 for 20 tea bags. You can snag 6 boxes of this which will net you 96 tea bags for the same price! It's a steal I tell ya!! ​

title: My New Obsession -- Yogi's Ginger Tea
body: Oh My Goodness! This Ginger Tea by Yogi is a new obsession with me! I drink it every single night before I go to bed!  It has a mildly spiciness to it. The longer you leave the tea bag in the spicier it gets! As a side note - - - great accompaniment to anything sweet!

title: It worked for me... no more sniffles
body: Bought this brand in a local store and fell in love with the taste.  I haven't even had the sniffles since I started drinking this.  Not sure if it's really the tea but not going to quit.  I like the fact I received so many boxes at once and the overall price was less then buying at the local store.

title: The price/quality ratio is right and I will probably buy this product repeatedly because I haven't found anything better. I've t
body: The flavor is just pure chamomile. The price/quality ratio is right and I will probably buy this product repeatedly because I haven't found anything better. I've tried many brands. My husband and I sleep much better after a nice cup of this tea. For a relaxing afternoon treat, I drink the over-ice version which helps me avoid soda altogether. This product is an integral part of my daily routine and I wouldn't wish to be without it.

title: Has weaned me off of Afrin.
body: Has weaned me off of Afrin. Clear nasal passages all day with one cup of tea!

title: Too much Stevia!!
body: I am an avid stevia user, however this tea has a very distinct and bothersome taste. I won't call it an "aftertaste" because it's the first thing that hits you when you take a sip. The stevia is so pronounced, that I can't even comment on the overall taste. My 14 yo son (who is also a stevia user) doesn't like it because of the stevia taste. He commented on it the first time he tried it and I hadn't even said anything to him. On the positive side, I have been sleeping well since I started using this tea. I'm on my second of six boxes that I bought from Amazon, I want to like this tea, because it seems to be effective, but will keep looking for an alternative unless they cut back on the amount of stevia. I also ordered six boxes of the Yogi Skin-Detox tea at the same time and it's wonderful and effective. It also contains stevia, but doesn't have the "aftertaste" at all.

title: Tea the way tea should be!
body: My husband recently stopped smoking (yay!) and this tea has really helped him clear all that junk out of his chest.  It has a pleasant taste and aroma, being neither too strong or too weak, and we both find ourselves drinking it simply for the flavor. This tea is great to drink during and after having any type of chest cold.  Good way to get fluids and soothe a cough related to illness.

title: It's not easy to find this tea in our grocery stores
body: My husband often has a scratchy throat, probably from acid reflux. Several weeks ago my sister gave him a couple tea bags of this product and he said it was soothing to his throat so I ordered this pack of 6 boxes from Amazon. It's not always an easy tea to find in grocery stores and this is so much more convenient. He's been drinking it every night so it looks like I'll be ordering more in the future.

title: This Really Brings On Restful Sleep for Me!
body: I have trouble staying asleep and find myself up reading at 2 AM.  I tried this tea (other things have not worked for me).  After about 15 minutes, I noticed myself getting a little sleepy and went back to bed.  I wasn't heavily groggy, just sleepy and warm and I was able to go back to sleep.  What a gift this has been for me.

title: Love it!!!
body: I love this tea.  I was skeptical to try it because i hate black licorice.  My husband doesn't drink tea and he really likes the flavor of this.  This is so much cheaper than buying at a grocery store, and i never know if the store will have this flavor.  I will purchase this again.

title: Tasty Tea
body: This tea has a nice flavor, although it is hard to say if it is actually increasing my joint comfort.  The power of placebo can be just as powerful, if not more so, than any herb or medicine out there.

title: tastes okay but seems to work when you drink A LOT of it
body: Tea is very licorice tasting, so not my favorite but when mixed with enough sugar and vanilla creamer is not so bad. I think this helps more when you consistently drink at least 3 cups a day, which can be expensive.  But don't expect an over flow of milk when you sparingly drink one cup a day.

title: Good value when you buy in bulk
body: Good value when you buy in bulk, since we drink ginger tea almost every other day. I find Yogi to have the most flavorful ginger tea with a "bite". Other brands tastes very watered down. Wife uses ginger tea to help her upset stomach, works every time.

title: Five Stars
body: I would write a review, but I'm so relieved of stress all I can do is this.

title: does what it says
body: I drank this tea on a few occasions, and it truly does produce a calming effect.  It has a strong licorice flavor, which I dislike, but if you can get past the strong aroma, this may be a tea that you want regularly.  I don't recommend drinking it double strength (made with two tea bags) the first time you try it.  One bag will work for most people.  I tried it with two bags after I had been drinking it for a while, and I found it to be overpowering for me, and it knocked me out cold for a couple of hours.  I had to allow some time for it to wear off, and I didn't feel alert and steady for a while.  Yogi is a brand that I can highly recommend.

title: Highly Recommend!
body: Absolutely love this tea! Helps settle a full or upset stomach, and it tastes great too. My husband and I drink a cup every night before bed. Would highly recommend if you have any sort of stomach troubles!

title: Great choice for a hearty, morning beverage.
body: I don't drink coffee, so I have en extensive collection of herb teas for different seasons and moods.  This is my second overall favorite.  My absolute, hands-down favorite "Herbal Coffee Alternative" is Teecino Hazelnut.

title: This has been a lifesaver for my roommate. She ...
body: This has been a lifesaver for my roommate.  She has intense cat allergies but still has cats and so do I.  This helps her get through the day when the antihistamines aren't quite cutting it.  This one is also much more palatable than the same sort of product by other companies.  It's still 'savory' but much more mild and melded.

title: Good for a sweet tooth
body: This tea was recommended to me by a nutritionist as a way to get something sweet in the evening when you have a craving. This tea tastes good without any additives but also tastes good with almond milk or a drop or two of the liquid Stevia. The quantity is nice because you have plenty of it around. Caffeine amount is low in this tea so it won't keep you up all night.

title: Love that ginger!
body: Absolutely love the ginger tea. Very relaxing, intense flavor with a little ginger bite at the end. I have a cup a day as an anti-inflammatory and they have worked great. I particularly like the way that the bags are individually wrapped to preserve maximum flavor. A great buy, great tea.

title: We drink a cup almost every evening during the winter ...
body: We drink a cup almost every evening during the winter months.  I also give boxes to ill friends.  I absolutely believe this stuff helps our immune system fight off common cold viruses and such.  Very hard to find in local stores, so always order from Amazon.

title: Our Yoga instructor at work introduced us to this product ...
body: Our Yoga instructor at work introduced us to this product.  Deep and flavorful with rich notes of Cardamom and Black Pepper, this is all we drink at work.  Many of my associated have given up coffee for this tea.  It is all i drink on the weekends.  not your normal English Breakfast Tea!

title: Best Herbal Chai Tea
body: A friend shared this tea with me and I have been in love with it ever since.  It is warm, not too spicy, and not at all sweet, which is why I like it. I enjoy it without sweetener, but can add a little honey or agave and a spot of cream for a special cup that is more like dessert.

title: It tastes good.
body: I started drinking this tea when I was 30 weeks pregnant with my son.  Since this was my first child, I don't have anything to compare labor/contractions to, but I was induced at 41 weeks and the contractions were not as awful as I expected.  I can't say that this tea had any affect on my labor but I will definitely drink again during pregnancy #2.  It tastes good.

title: I love Yogi pure chamomile tea after dinner so this package ...
body: I love Yogi pure chamomile tea after dinner so this package is just the right size to get through the long cold winter months.  Most varieties of chamomile have some other flavor but this is just chamomile and is both relaxing and helps settle the digestive system.

title: GREAT stuff...doesn't taste funny to me with honey :-D
body: I love this stuff! I made the mistake of trying out the Nuva Ring when my doctor kind of guilted me into thinking that I need to he on birth control of some sort. HUGE mistake! My milk supply dwindled to almost half the very next day! I discontinued use of the birth control and immediately ordered this tea and some fenugreek capsules. My milk suplly started increasing by the third day of drinking this tea and taking the fenugreek. I'm not promising that it will work for you but I sure do swear by it. I'm not one ro err in the way of blind herbal remedies but this one actually works :-D

title: This is my all time favorite licorice tea--the flavor is deep and sweet without the ...
body: This is my all time favorite licorice tea--the flavor is deep and sweet without the addition of sugar! It goes down smooth and refreshing. The perfect combination of mint and licorice. A perfect after dinner tea.

title: Warm. Sweet. Comforting.
body: I am addicted to this tea!  It is a great sweet treat after dinner or whenever you really want something sweetly comforting.  This is the 2nd time I have purchased the 6 box set and will most probably purchase again when I run out.

title: Good nursing support tea
body: I decided to try this tea as I was returning to work and needed to pump for my baby. I wanted to ensure my supply was adequate and this tea has been helpful. The taste wasn't initially my favorite (not terrible though), but now I enjoy it. There isn't much of an anise/black licorice flavor and I have no problem drinking 1-3 cups a day. I think I've had more success with lactation cookies versus tea, but I also don't drink 3 cups/day as the packaging recommends. Definitely worth trying!

title: LOVE this tea
body: This is one of my most favorite teas. I brew a cup of this almost every night and add a little bit of half and half. It has a nice light licorice flavor and the stevia in it adds the perfect amount of sweetness. Everyone I've made it for loves it, too. Even my sister in law who hates anise flavored things. And it really does seem to work. :) Also this is a great value. Especially if you get it on subscribe and save with enough stuff for 15% off.

title: Pretty Good
body: As far as chai teas go, this is pretty good. The spices are a little strong, and the rooibos background gives it a different air than a green tea chai. It is good for when I need to wake up and is awesome with a little bit of cream. I often have this when I need a pick-me-up at work. There are sayings on each of the tea tabs, which are kind of like fortune cookie fortunes. Sometimes they are nice, but most of the time they are kind of condescending. I do like that each bag is individually wrapped, so it doesn't collect dust or dirt if I get sidetracked before I can make my tea.

title: and its pretty hard to find in stores where i live
body: I bought this online, as its cheaper to buy in bulk , and its pretty hard to find in stores where i live. I originally tried the traditional medicinals brand and , not only did it taste better ,but also it did not leave this sick murcky brown film all over your cup.I really dont enjoy yogis brand , and I still have 5 more boxes to plow through!

title: Five Stars
body: Works better than other detox teas. No cramping at mall. A must try.

title: Oh my gosh!
body: Best brand yet. This tea makes me relaxed and drowsy so I can doze off quicker. If you have a lot on your mind, or stress in your life and have trouble going to sleep you should really try this tea. Great taste, not bitter at all. I put a little honey in it. Both my husband and I are using it. You will love the taste. Let it steep the full amount of time. It's not going to knock you out but will relax you and make it easier to go to sleep.

title: tasty tea!
body: I really like the taste of it and thinking it might help having an easier birth makes it motivating to drink tea even in the summertime. It contains a lot of Mint, so this is what is determining the taste, it's fresh and nice!

title: Just try it
body: I have a problem stomach, so I tried this tea. Don't judge it by the first cup,. Takes getting used to the flavor, but you do come to enjoy it. I have found most times it does settle my stomach. Gave a box to both my daughter, and daughter in law,hope they have good results. Would recommend it. This is also a great price

title: I loved this tea when I was nursing my babies
body: I loved this tea when I was nursing my babies. I had trouble with getting (and keeping!) my milk flowing.. This seemed to make a difference. I enjoyed it warm with a splash of milk and honey, or iced with some sugar like sweet tea :) The subscription price makes it a great deal! I recommend this to all my nursing mama friends!

title: THE BEST CHAI EVER
body: With all the weight loss and anti-oxidant benefits of GREEN TEA, I've been a little shocked that not only are there not MORE "green" chai teas out there - but that most stores don't stock this Yogi version.  Black tea also has benefits but far less (in my understanding) that green.  Bigelow's version was so weak i had to use 2 or 3 bags to get any flavor.  But this brand is amazing and the perfect non-coffee day starter especially with a bit of organic whole milk/cream and a few drops of vanilla stevia.

title: Yummy and does the job
body: I need to talk at work and sing at church, often overworking my vocal chords. This is my go to tea because its tastes great and provides a soothing feeling to my throat, more so than any other teas. Prime shipping is only offered for the pack of 6, but I stock up because this is well worth it.

title: Tasty refreshing tea
body: This is a very tasty tea. The tea is sweet enough to my taste that I don't need to add a sweetener. I usually drink it as it without adding anything.  I prefer this brand of licorice tea to many other brands of licorice tea that I have tried. I find that this tea produces a general sense of well being  for a day or two after I drink it.  There really isn't much I can add to other reviews of this tea except to also give it my vote of confidence.

title: My new favorite tea! I got a sample of this at ...
body: My new favorite tea!  I got a sample of this at a local store, and I immediately rushed home to order from Amazon (at a much better price, of course!).  I've since been drinking it nonstop at work, as the flavor is just so unique and refreshing.  Neither the licorice nor the mint is overwhelming, but they're both very noticeable.  I really think Yogi hit a homerun with this one!

title: Tasty Tea
body: YUM! My chiropractor recommended that I drink licorice tea daily to improve adrenal gland function. I drink at least 1 and usually 3 cups of this tea daily. The tea is delicious. Today, I will be drinking at 10 cups having awakened with an unpleasant cough. The tea is very soothing.

title: Wonderful Tea!
body: I'm a chiropractor specializing in fertility, pre-natal, and pediatric care.  I always have this tea here in the office because of it's healing and soothing effect on the female reproductive system.  I recommend it for menstrual cramps, any cycle irregularity, during pregnancy, and general uterine health.  It's a miraculous ancient remedy used by native cultures for centuries.  I've always loved the quality of Yogi Teas and their Red Raspberry Leaf is delicious.  For those who haven't tried it, it's like a mild black tea in flavor and naturally a little sweet. Try drinking it throughout your next period and see how soothing it is for yourself. I usually drink a cup every day and maybe two during my period. Enjoy!  Colleen [...]

title: Delicious and Healthy Chai Tea!
body: I'm really happy I found this tea - it's great tasting, caffeine-free, gluten-free, has no natural flavoring, and it's organic to top it off.  Most important to me was caffeine-free and no natural flavoring, and I couldn't find that in another chai tea, so when I found this, I ordered it, hoping I would enjoy it (since I was getting 6 boxes of it), and I ended up loving the taste more than any other chai teas I've tried.  This is something I'll constantly keep stocked in my home.

title: The perfect evening tea
body: Every night for the last several years my husband and I have a cup of this tea. It's our favorite way to relax in the evening before bed. It has a nice subtle flavor we haven't found in any other similarly marketed tea. If you enjoy hot tea regularly and you're in the market for an evening tea, I would easily recommend this choice.

title: Subtle Pleasure
body: Egyptian Licorice has a subtle, mild licorice flavor that makes a very satisfying drink with a pleasant and lasting aftertaste.  It is perfect for those times in the day when you just need a quiet break, or if it is time to settle in with a good book.  I strongly recommend that you let this tea steepe for 10 minutes to allow it to fully release the flavor and I find it is best without any food which can overwhelm its delicate taste.

title: GERD, LPR, and Reflux beware this is a tasty but double sided sword....
body: I like to think of myself as a tea person.  Yogi tea's are some of my favorites and I have a high opinion of them.  This tea is no exception.  The flavor quality is consistent to what I would come to expect from their products.  Just the right amount of ginger flavor that its not overpowering and flavorful.  The main issue I have with this tea (and nearly all ginger tea's I've come across) is the use of black pepper.  Many of the yogi teas come with black pepper as an ingredient, which is fine from a flavor stand point (India Spice for instance, I love the cinnamon bold flavor), but not for this tea.  About six months ago I was inflicted with stomach issues, and a huge no-no is black pepper.  The whole point of ginger tea is to calm a stomach.  So that's why I took a star away.  There is no place for black pepper in ginger tea.  I would be fine if they renamed it to "Spicy Ginger" and created a new Ginger tea that the sole purpose was to soothe a stomach.  Essentially it still works for calming provided I steep the bag (do not pour water over the bag, obviously) for about 10-15 seconds and promptly remove, only slightly squeezing to keep the bag from dripping.  It's weak enough that you still get the calming effects.  Alternatively, if you have the time, you can just make your own ginger tea with real ginger root.  What I do like about this tea over other ginger teas I've looked at: no stevia leaf added.

A friend recommended this tea and said I should give a try that it had worked wonders for her. I started taking 1-2 a day and now I make a jar every morning at work and instead of drinking wanter I drink this. My first period after getting off the pill was quite horrible and painful, by the second month the PMS, cramps and pain were much less and I just recently saw my period for the 3rd time after the pill and I must say I am so thankful to this tea, cramps lasted a little over 3 hours the first day and after that I had no pain at all, minor discomfort but nothing out of the ordinary. I wasn't as depressed, my emotions weren't all over the place as per usual and it was all together a smoother process. I will definitely continue to purchase this tea. I truly recommend it.

body: As any woman going through monthly cramps knows, the pain and irritability turn you into a crazed werewolf. That's why this tea is so appropriately named. This fennel concoction is so potent that I use one bag for three teas. The blend of herbs, especially the ginger, is very warming and soothing. body: This tea tastes great just as it is with no additional additives. This is my nightly brew before bed time and has replaced my previous brew (Yogi Detox) due to the great taste (though Detox isn't bad, this is just better).

title: Tasty without sugar
body: I first had this tea at least 6-7 years ago; it was in my friend's mom's tea collection. I was intrigued by the name and the old box--the packaging looked way cooler back then. Well, I had one cup, and then another--maybe even three while we were hanging out. I liked it a lot, obviously, but I forgot about it until a few months ago when I started getting into drinking tea instead of coffee--it just popped into my head--"hey, THAT was some REALLY good tea!"  Luckily I remembered the name and was happy to find it and ordered a 6-pack. I was even more delighted to find that it was sweet enough without any sugar or stevia or anything, thanks to the licorice--and I have a sweet tooth.  It as a nice, full flavor--certainly not just that of licorice, which sort of hits your palate as the last note. The other herbs, spices and orange flavor complement it beautifully. Highly recommended, by someone who (like most people) HATES black jelly beans--those are a poor excuse for a representation of what licorice should taste like. Enjoy this instead.

body: Drink this stuff every night. Tastes better than any other bedtime or chamomile tea I have tried, and there have been many. Also love the little messages on each tea bag that remind you how to live a good life.

I also love the little sayings / affirmations on the tag of each tea bag.  Such a simple pleasure.

body: This tea is incredible.  Anytime I feel like I'm starting to get sick I start drinking this tea and poof!  no more sickness.  I'm prone to sinus infections just because of my allergies so this stuff is great.  Some of my friends comment that the taste is not that great, bt I really enjoy it.  It's a very earthy tea and has a strong ginger flavor.

title: I'll go ahead and say that this is my favorite tea to drink
body: I'll go ahead and say that this is my favorite tea to drink. I've always wanted to try Echinacea tea, so I decided to try a couple different brands to see which one I liked the best. I bought this brand and the Traditional Medicinals brand. What I like best about Echinacea tea is the tingly, yet lightly aromatic, sensation it creates when you drink it. Yogi has a more prominent taste and sensation to it compared to the other brand.

If you mix a bag of this chai with the Yogi Egyptian Licorice, what a great combination!

title: My favorite tea
body: Tea isn't necessarily something that I go around raving about to people but it's funny how many people I've recommended this to or to whom I given a box. It's just so good, needs no sweetening and great for post-meal or for calming at the end of a day. I like to try new flavors but I keep coming back to this one as a perfect stand-by.

title: Afternoon tea
body: I can't drink caffeine after 2 pm, so I drink this Vanilla Hazelnut. Good tasting and has enough flavor to hold up to adding milk to it. Very reputable brand and consistent flavor. Also individually packaged tea bags, so I can carry one in my purse for eating out -- just ask for hot water.

title: Great for reducing PMS symptoms
body: The best tip I have been giving related to menstrual issues is to take this tea.  It tastes great.  I have a warm cup of this tea in the morning everyday the week before my period.  I often pour the rest from the pot into a glass to refrigerate and have a tasty cool treat in the afternoon.  It has significantly reduced my cramping, flow and general blah feelings that come with my period.  I love the yogi tea bag tags that have little quotes with positive thoughts for the day.

title: It's Chai Tea
body: Yes it's Chai Tea but I'm not as crazy about it as many of the other posters.  To me it lacks the spice everyone else that gave it 5 stars claims it has.  I'll drink it, but when it is gone I'll try something else. I wouldn't tell anyone not to purchase this but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone either.  That is why I give it 3 stars as I believe it is an average Chai Tea at best.

title: Just plain works!
body: I get a chest cold every winter which settles in my lungs and causes me to cough for months without relief. My doctor says it is normal and there is little I can do to prevent it. Well, Yogi Cold Season tea helps a lot! I have been drinking a cup a day of this outstanding tea since Thanksgiving and so far, knock on wood, I have not had my usual chest congestion. Other reviewers testify to this fact - it works. If you get chest congestion, give it a try. By the way, ignore those who say the taste is awful. Not true. No, it is not delicious, but it certainly is acceptable.

title: Tastes good and smells good.
body: I brought a pack of 6, I gave one to some of my nursing classmates, knowing how much stress we are under. We were pleasantly surprised to see how relaxed and rested we felt when we woke up. Don't get me wrong, it doesn't make you sleepy. Nonetheless, once you sleep, you wake up the next day you don't feel tired.

title: Not good for some of us -- be aware of your body's reactions during the first week of use.
body: I suffer from migraines and decided it was because of my bad eating habits over many years.  Eating more real foods and raw foods made me feel good, so I decided to speed the process by doing some "lite" detox by drinking this tea.  I figured this is mild (it's just a tea) so I probably drank several cups the first day and at least 2 a day after that.  I had some headaches that weren't the same or as bad as my usual migraines, but the first round was still debilitating.  I recall thinking maybe I should cut back to just one detox tea a day, so did.  10 days later I got another headache like the one before but slightly milder -- better than a migraine, but still very unpleasant, but no vomiting this time.  Then I started having continuous headaches every day and night, and couldn't figure out why since I was eating much healthier and had even lost a few pounds.  I felt awful all the time and was getting really depressed that it wasn't going away and I didn't know what to do to get better -- I was doing all the right things!  I racked my brains and recalled earlier linking headaches to too much detox tea, so I stopped drinking it altogether -- headaches gone in 2 days off the tea.

title: Gentle Medicine
body: I don't use a lot of this, but I find that a couple of sips after a meal helps with digestion.  It has also been very helpful with occasional bouts of abdominal pain.  It might be too sweet for some people, but is fine for my taste.

title: A really good tea.
body: Ginger is definitely good for your stomach and I have searched many products in order to find a ginger tea that tastes good.  Yogi Ginger Tea is definitely my choice and I drink it every day.  It is fairly mild in flavor so you can let it steep longer than you normally would with other teas.  I like a little honey in mine but can also enjoy it plain.  I have a standing order for this tea and can  recommend it to anyone who enjoys the flavor of ginger.

This tea is decent but I can barely taste this licorice due to the mint (almost too minty at times). Still, it is a good tea but not quite what I was hoping for.

body: There is no better tea, I swear it tastes delicious and there's no placebo effect here, it really eases tension and the little saying on the tea tag is a nice way to enjoy the moment and bring peace :)

Luckily I remembered the name and was happy to find it and ordered a 6-pack. I was even more delighted to find that it was sweet enough without any sugar or stevia or anything, thanks to the licorice--and I have a sweet tooth.  It as a nice, full flavor--certainly not just that of licorice, which sort of hits your palate as the last note. The other herbs, spices and orange flavor complement it beautifully. Highly recommended, by someone who (like most people) HATES black jelly beans--those are a poor excuse for a representation of what licorice should taste like. Enjoy this instead.

I am recommending this product for anyone out there who is looking to make sure they get the most out of their milk for their little one!

title: Effective and easy to drink
body: I was pleasantly surprised by this tea... I'm in good health generally and I don't take any medications.  I ordered this because the other reviews intrigued me, and I knew I wanted to gently support my liver & kidneys.  I'm not an expert on elimination or anything, but I feel like this makes those processes more effective.  Since last summer I've been on a mission to lose about 25 pounds, so I changed my diet and exercise habits, and lost 20 lbs by November; that seemed to be my limit and I was OK with it. title: A nightly ritual
body: I've been drinking Yogi Bedtime tea on an almost nightly basis since at least 2008.  It helps me calm down from a stressful or eventful day and settle down to sleep.  The flavor is very balanced and slightly earthy, with a very slightly sweet taste from stevia that carries through as a very subtle undertone.  You think, "Hmmm, tastes much better than chamomile alone, maybe a bit of mint?  Is that a little sweet note?  I wonder what that is?" Drinking a cup of Bedtime tea has become a nightly ritual that I share with my 2 daughters, who need that as a cue to wind down and prepare for going to bed.  They've really come to enjoy that special time we spend together at the end of the day.  That could apply to *any* tea, but this one is really special.  I had it on subscription for a while, and then all of a sudden, there was no Bedtime Tea available in the US.  Some kind of a supply problem with Yogi, I'm guessing, because No One had any.  So we tried about 8 other brands of tea, trying to find an acceptable substitute for this one.  I went on to all sorts of tea review sites and read the hipsters all say how horrible this is.  I tried what they recommended, and the brands they liked tasted like swill to us, and didn't help us get sleepy.  So each to her own.  Tea is a very personal preference and you'll just have to try it and see if it's something you like, but I can attest to the fact that it does help you get sleepy.  Also, you can't beat the price Amazon offers, compared to the supermarket price per box.  If this is the kind of thing you drink on a daily basis, getting a carton makes sense.  We go through the whole carton of 6 boxes in about a month for 3 people.

body: This Sampler Pack has 4 different kinds of Yogi tea - all geared for people that are sick. The 4 kinds are: Breathe Deep, Throat Comfort, Echinacea Immune Support, and Cold Season. I have used all 4 kinds, to be honest, I think they all taste bad. None of them have a pleasant taste, but with a little bit of honey, most are tolerable. My reason for 5 stars, all ingredients are Organic and it is a more natural way to treat people that are sick instead of taking medicine. I do believe that they all have benefits - helping a sore throat, helping you to breathe more easily (congestion), and help to alleviate cold symptoms. Do they cure sickness? NO - but neither does medicine, these help by increasing your liquid intake when you are sick. As some other reviewers mentioned, many of these contain licorice root - which may impact blood pressure in some people. So if you have blood pressure problems you should consider carefully before using these products.

The tea actually tastes quite decent, I add just one little packet of sugar to it (I'm not a huge tea fan to begin with). I haven't tried Mother's Milk, but I've heard it tastes terrible, so I was pleased with the taste of this tea as I'd been dreading trying nursing tea. I can't specifically say that this tea helps with milk production as I was working with a lactation specialist who also had me taking additional supplements at the same time. What I can say is that three times a day, I take a few moments to drink this tea, which boosts the amount of water I am consuming and lowers my stress level, two things that are very helpful when trying to boost your supply. I would highly recommend this tea, and I now purchase it from Amazon at a great rate.

title: A nightly ritual
body: I've been drinking Yogi Bedtime tea on an almost nightly basis since at least 2008.  It helps me calm down from a stressful or eventful day and settle down to sleep.  The flavor is very balanced and slightly earthy, with a very slightly sweet taste from stevia that carries through as a very subtle undertone.  You think, "Hmmm, tastes much better than chamomile alone, maybe a bit of mint?  Is that a little sweet note?  I wonder what that is?" Drinking a cup of Bedtime tea has become a nightly ritual that I share with my 2 daughters, who need that as a cue to wind down and prepare for going to bed.  They've really come to enjoy that special time we spend together at the end of the day.  That could apply to *any* tea, but this one is really special.  I had it on subscription for a while, and then all of a sudden, there was no Bedtime Tea available in the US.  Some kind of a supply problem with Yogi, I'm guessing, because No One had any.  So we tried about 8 other brands of tea, trying to find an acceptable substitute for this one.  I went on to all sorts of tea review sites and read the hipsters all say how horrible this is.  I tried what they recommended, and the brands they liked tasted like swill to us, and didn't help us get sleepy.  So each to her own.  Tea is a very personal preference and you'll just have to try it and see if it's something you like, but I can attest to the fact that it does help you get sleepy.  Also, you can't beat the price Amazon offers, compared to the supermarket price per box.  If this is the kind of thing you drink on a daily basis, getting a carton makes sense.  We go through the whole carton of 6 boxes in about a month for 3 people.

body: I bought this recently to help with gastritis symptoms. Further investigation revealed that one of the ingredients is "Organic Black Pepper". This is an odd choice for a "Stomach Ease" tea, since people with any kind of acidity problems are supposed to avoid spicy ingredients like Pepper. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone with acidity issues such as gastritis, ulcers, GERD, etc.

I have tried prescription pain medication and birth control to alleviate my pain. The prescription pain meds always made me sleepy (which is terrible while I'm at work, or need to drive) and for personal reasons I am not on birth control at the moment. When I wasn't taking either, I would take between 6-10 ibuprofen each day for the first 2 days of my cycle. Don't get me wrong, I still have to take it, but not nearly as much. So far, I have only drank the tea during the cycle, usually about 5 bags each day. I have done this for the past 3 months. But, I am going to start drinking it throughout the month... title: Don't believe the reveiws that claim its week. Very Cinnamony flavor and 2 teabags in 1 cup was WAY TOO STRONG
body: Because I believed the other reviewers claiming it was week and because I wanted a good nights sleep I put 2 bags in 1.5 cups of boiling water.  Added a lil sugar and when it cooled I sipped it - it smelled the whole kitchen up like cinnamon and spice - so whoever thinks this stuff is week is smoking crack!  I had to add another half cup of water just to drink it and yes I did get a slight tingle on my tounge.  Not sure if it helped me sleep or not. I used to drink Cammomile teas and have several I LOVE - but I finally found out that it was causing an allergy issue because I'm allergic to Ragweed (which almost everyone is) - and Cammomile is related - so I switched to Kava.  I made another cup tonight - 1 tea bag and it was much better - A lil spicy for me so I gave it 4 stars - I'm not a BIG tea drinker - only for medicinal purposes lol - so don't go by my judgement - but trust me it is strong. I'm going to try a few other sleep tea's that don't have cammomile in them - so while looking I felt I should set the record straight on this one's strength.

title: Not good for some of us -- be aware of your body's reactions during the first week of use.
body: I suffer from migraines and decided it was because of my bad eating habits over many years.  Eating more real foods and raw foods made me feel good, so I decided to speed the process by doing some "lite" detox by drinking this tea.  I figured this is mild (it's just a tea) so I probably drank several cups the first day and at least 2 a day after that.  I had some headaches that weren't the same or as bad as my usual migraines, but the first round was still debilitating.  I recall thinking maybe I should cut back to just one detox tea a day, so did.  10 days later I got another headache like the one before but slightly milder -- better than a migraine, but still very unpleasant, but no vomiting this time.  Then I started having continuous headaches every day and night, and couldn't figure out why since I was eating much healthier and had even lost a few pounds.  I felt awful all the time and was getting really depressed that it wasn't going away and I didn't know what to do to get better -- I was doing all the right things!  I racked my brains and recalled earlier linking headaches to too much detox tea, so I stopped drinking it altogether -- headaches gone in 2 days off the tea.

I was hoping that, as some of the reviews on here have stated, this tea would help me relax without having to turn to medications again. I had some before bed last night and fell into a deep, wonderful sleep. I had a cup this morning at the office and while at first it made my head a little foggy (won't steep my tea that strong anymore at work), that effect wore off and I was able to go out for lunch on my own! Hopefully this continues as I incorporate Yogi Kava Stress Relief Tea into my daily lifestyle. The taste is also a little odd, kinda like a spicy chocolate. It is something to get used to. body: I don't usually leave reviews, but sometimes a product comes along that I feel is exceptionally good. NOW Foods and their Kava Kava extract is one of them. Their Kava Kava liquid extract is a wonderful product that I recommend for anyone who wishes to experience a greater sense of well-being. The liquid can be put into juice or water, and it has a flavor that to me tastes like carrots. That may not be the same for everyone, but for me that is the case. title: Tried this and can’t turn back now
body: I’ve started working a very hectic job in the past year, and have subsequently turned into a zombie. Seriously, I’ve spent the past six months with 2-3 hours of sleep per night, and every day being on the consistent verge of a stress vomit. When I noticed that my receding hairline was transforming from a slow crawl to a sprint, I decided to take some action. I began my search for a product that could help reduce my stress and anxiety, and also knock me out at night so that I could sleep. Unfortunately, because of my beloved Vermont-ian background, that product absolutely couldn’t be a prescription drug. After some searching (okay, fine, my sister did the searching) I found this Kava Root, and decided to give it a whirl. The first time I took it, after gagging the disgusting little buggers back, I lay on my back and waited for a miracle to happen, and all of a sudden I opened my eyes and it was morning and my alarm was going off. After doing extensive research I decided on Kava Kava because it provided immediate and as needed relief as opposed to something I had to take everyday for weeks before feeling a difference. For me anxiety and depression go hand in hand so though I know Kava isn't marketed specifically towards depression it does affect it for me. From the first time I tried Kava I noticed the difference. Just today I was experiencing extreme irritability, aggression, overstimulation and social anxiety as well as depressive symptoms; at one point I broke out in frustrated and desperate sobs because I was so overwhelmed. Afterward I took two Kava, and within a half hour felt myself coming back to a more stable baseline. Within an hour or two I was completely mellow and calm. Couple hours later I was ready for a nap. It's a great product, and for me more practical and cost effective than paying co-pays and prescription fees for antidepressants and anxiety meds that I have to take every day and deal with scary side-effects.
